review_body: The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. It was smaller than anticipated especially for 4 adults (room was advertised to sleep 5 adults). View of the Empire State Building was very nice. The breakfast included with the rental was very tasty with a wide selection of breakfast options such as eggs, bacon, roasted potatoes, oatmeal, waffles, fruit, yogurt, banana bread, toast etc. The dining area is small and often does not accommodate all guests. Dining hours are too early and food was taken up early every day we were there sometimes a half hour early with no restocking of depleted items. Staff would usually try to scrounge up something for you if you asked though. Staff was courteous and helpful with suggestions on area restaurants and transit instructions. Parking was convenient but pricey as it cost more than a nights stay in the hotel. Proximity to Herald Square and Penn Station subway lines was perfect. Overall, a nice stay and the family had a great time in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Located in a very central point of New York, affordable prices. Room was very clean and tidy. There is a small gym in the basement. Breakfast is not rich but OK with Starbucks coffee and scrambled egg.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a great location. I would highly recommend the Empire State building view. The staff was ultra friendly. Benefit from being a Hyatt rewards member. It makes checking in a breeze - you just need to pick up your keys. The room was very clean and the bathroom was nice. I would recommend this for anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A great time in NYC. Location was excellent and due to us booking early the price was reasonable. Every day the staff was very helpful with our questions and requests. The view was nice and rooms were quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff, atmosphere, location were all impecable. We had never been to New York and took a chance on this property and we were so very pleasantly surprised. We can hardly wait to get back to New York and will definately chose this property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice and cozy hotel with friendly stuff on amazing location. The The view on Empire State Building from room or roof terrace is great, not to mention free coffee and tea during whole day in lobby is a nice touch to feel welcome and more like at home.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We visited NYC the weekend before Christmas and stayed four nights at the Hyatt Place. We booked our trip only a few weeks in advance, and as you can imagine, availability for a family of five the weekend before Christmas was pretty slim. So, I was relieved to find a room at the Hyatt Place and even more relieved to see such positive reviews from prior guests. And, to our surprise, this ended up being one of our favorite hotels ever! The location is perfect. And when I say perfect, I mean perfect. We were only about a block away from Herald Square and from the subway station there, we could pretty much get everywhere we needed. Plenty of stores and restaurants were in walking distance, but I liked the fact that we weren't right in the middle of Times Square or one of the other heavy tourist locations. Our room was small and didn't have a view, but it was clean, quiet, and definitely didn't feel too cramped. The front desk and breakfast staff were always friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was really good, and a huge time-saver for us, since we were more focused on sightseeing and activities. The breakfast area is a little small and could get crowded, but we never had a problem finding a seat. We'd definitely stay here again and would recommend that others stay here as well! Thank you, Hyatt Place, for making our Christmas trip so great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Family room on floor 23 was good, 3 teenagers and parents managed for a week in the one room...... Not lots of room but you are out mainly!Free breafast is buffet style,can get cramped looking for spaces to sit when busy. But food is good, different hot and cold options,tea and coffee.There is also coffee and tea in foyer to help yourself,and a computer to use if needed.Staff very helpful and friendly. A small gym is avalible and on the 26 floor there is a little. Terrace you could use for a drink,snack or quiet read.Really central to sights,our second visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location for tourists! We had a quiet room with a view of the Empire State Building. The elevator worked most of the time but was very crowded during breakfast and check-out hours. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This Hotel has a very good breakfast and a friendly and helpful front desk and kitchen staff. There are only 2 elevators in the hotel and housekeeping shares those same elevators with the guest. We waited nine minutes one morning for the elevator. The housekeeper did not clean our room one day but the front desk staff made up for it by waiving our luggage fee after we had checked out. Overall, this hotel is a great value and I would stay here again. I gave it a four star only because of the elevator situation and our room not getting cleaned one day!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We checked in without our luggage as they were delayed during transit. The staff were lovely about it and provided us with extra toiletries. The room was spacious m, much bigger than anything I have stayed in in NYC before. Bathroom was clean and of a good size, great shower too. Breakfast was very busy each morning we went. On one day we had to wait for a table to clear before we could sit to eat. The only other downfall of this hotel is how slow the elevators were. They were almost always full at peak times too. Overall this hotel is in a great location, especially for visiting places like Madison Square Garden. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is a pleasant place in a conveniently located area. Great staff, nice amenities reasonably priced. I would definitely stay hear again and recommend it to family and friends.The breakfast isn't bad either!
user_name:
Safari36798145750
Long Island City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for almost 2 weeks over the Christmas/New Year period. Room was a great size, and breakfast was great (though get in early to avoid lines!).The hotel is walking distance to multiple subway lines and a large number of other attractions.Staff were friendly and helpful, and ensured we were always greeted with a smile. The only downside was peak the lifts became quite full or took a long time to arrive in peak times - not great if you’re on a higher floor! There’s not much the hotel can do about this however, and it’s not the end of the world. Aside from this minor detail, Would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was located very close to Macy’s. It wasn’t too far from Time Square. Bryant Park was only a few blocks away. I was very satisfied with how close it was to the things that we wanted to do. I would definitely book this location again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location to all you need to do, great value and across the street from The Keg Room, the most amazing pub we found all week! Convenient to all the action and energy that is New York. Unless you are uppity, this is the place to stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at this hotel at end of December. First time to New York.Brilliant location to everything.Hotel staff were brilliant. Staff at the front desk very helpful and polite.Answer to every query.Loved the breakfast. Never had banana bread in my life. One of my favourites now.My teenage kids loved the hotel which is a miracle. Spacious room space. Only downhill from my side was they didn't like sharing their beds which each other.Everything at walking distance.If we ever come again we will stay at this hotel.Thankyou Hyatt Place for making this stay memorable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We always stay at this hotel when heading to NYC. Clean, great breakfast and nice staff. Conveniently located. Highly recommend. Rooms are nice and nice little touches. Close to herald square subway station.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place New York Midtown South is an amazing hotel. It is placed in a strategic position, close to Times Square, to Penn station, to a Metro station and to Macy’s. The breakfast was excellent and full of high quality products. I will surely spend my next holiday in an Hyatt hotel because I felt like someone was taking care of me.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: 3rd time staying here and has been a good experience each time. Location is ideal. If the Empire State building, Macys, MSG, Bryant Park or Times Square or all of the above are in your plans, this is a perfect launching point for these. No reason to look elsewhere for next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: excellent and super 5 star recommended place to stay....proximity is the major plus for this hotel and friendly staff that helps you at every stage and feels you that you are at home is super plus.....all positive....

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very pleased with our stay. Checkin was seamless, staff were personable. The rooms were bright and as described and pictured online. The breakfast area was clean and food was fresh. Great location to Madison Square Garfen, Times Square, and Radio. We do have one complaint, our bags that we checked, for a very reasonable 3 dollars per bag, were found by my daughter sitting in the buffet/dining area unattended, in a clearly non secure location. She went back to use the restroom and found them sitting there. The staff were going in and out of the storage area getting other bags. So it is not clear why our bags were sitting unattended. Hence the non excellent review. The front desk was understaffed, however it was Christmas weekend, so somewhat understandable. We waited about 30 minutes to address our concern, and that we took our bags, but left because the line was so long.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here after originally booking double tree suites times square. Found that was closing so asked to move here. Lovely hotel with helpful reception staff, rooms obviously not as big as the double tree but we were only in there to rest and sleep and we had a superb view of the empire state building. Complimentary tea and coffee was welcome after a cold day walking around. We added breakfast to our booking and it was very good and cheap. $16 a day for all 5 of us, it would cost that per person in a diner so it saved us a lot of money. Walking distance to pretty much everywhere and handy for the subway. Will definitely stay here again when visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was visiting for business and this hotel was priced right in a close proximity to our NY office. Additionally, it was close to Times Square, Broadway and other area with a short walk. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was welcoming. Can't wait to go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location - a little more than a block from the nearest train station, walking distance to Empire State Building, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and much more. Great breakfast, but get down there early to avoid the crowd. Room/bathroom is a little small (two queen with sofa bed) but our family of 5 managed. Room #2002 has an excellent view of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt which was blocks from MSG. We attended the Duke vs. Texas Tech game and wanted a convenient hotel that was close. Hyatt never disappoints as their brand speaks for itself. Very happy with the stay and complimentary breakfast. Will stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I love Hyatt, but this hotel wasn't what I expected! I booked a king bed room, but the front desk gave me double bed room, which I wasn't informed at the first place, I found out when I went up to the room! Very disappointing! Plus the couch had holes in them, room was not very clean. the Manager was not helpful at all, she was rude with bad attitude. she was not professional at all!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were really impressed with this hotel!! The staff was so friendly, very accommodating and the room was very nice and clean. I would highly recommend this place. We could see the Empire State Building from our room. See the photos.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is perfect and in the heart of a lot of famous NYC landmarks. The subway station was a block away so it was easy for us to get to other parts of Manhattan as well. We really loved the quick walk to Times Square. All of the staff members we interacted with were super friendly (and funny) and extremely helpful when it came to navigating NYC as well as accommodating any needs we had. The room was clean and spacious. It was an overall awesome experience and one of the best Hyatt’s I’ve ever been in. Thank you for making our vacation memorable!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is located very conveniently to my business needs in Midtown. Close to restaurants, convenient for transportation.Hotel is well managed and consistently excellent.I have stayed at this property many times and always return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location in heart of NYC. Walked to all the sites and shows. Helpful staff who accomodated our requests for room change at check in. Room are updated and very clean. Breakfast buffet offered a big variety of hot and cold items. Coffee available all day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, excellent staff, love the breakfast!Easy walking distance to Times Square the Theater district. Good restaurants within walking distance. The staff is very warm and welcoming and makes you feel like family. Ask for a room with a view of Empire State Building on one of the higher floors.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We are regulars in NYC. Make it a point to always come for a weekend in December to enjoy the sights, sounds, food, etc.....Hyatt Place on 36th is the perfect place to stay. We find the location excellent, and the facility is very comfortable. Staff is always friendly and accomodating. Can't wait to visit again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed our stay last week. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were excellent with good options and there was plenty of food.The room was a bit small (I expect similar in NYC) and well located near Herald Square and the subway.I'd stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at this hotel end of November / beginning of December for a family holiday. Before our trip, I emailed Hyatt requesting two rooms at the top of the hotel facing the Empire State building. The response I received back seemed to indicate this wouldn't be a problem, however upon arrival we didn't receive this request which was quite disappointing. The hotel is in a good location and is within walking distance from a lot of the tourist attractions. However, even though the hotel is in a good location, the street is quite noisy. We stayed on the 14th floor roadside and we could hear the traffic all night even though we were quite high up. Our room was a good size and the bed was very comfy but there was definitely room for improvement. We had no wardrobe door and no mirror in the room, only a mirror in the bathroom which was a pain trying to get ready in the morning entirely in the bathroom. The bathroom floor was also quite cold so I would recommend taking some slippers. We also had a temperamental TV and some days it was so frustrating we didn't even bother to turn it on.The hotel breakfast was excellent and the hot food changed every day. The breakfast room was sometimes quite busy but we always managed to find a table. The lobby also has free coffee, tea and flavoured water which is a nice touch. When we checked in, we were also told we were eligible for two free bottles of water a day. However, on our last day my parents were told they weren't actually eligible for the water even though they had been given it for the past few days so this was a bit frustrating. There are also only two lifts in the hotel so you can be waiting a while for one. Make sure you go to the roof terrace on the top floor, it has a good view of the Empire State building. Overall, the hotel has it's good points but definitely needs to improve in some areas. Even though the breakfast was great, I wouldn't stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a great stay and good location at the Hyatt Place Midtown-South NYC. Breakfast is good. Staff is great and very helpful and always with a smile. Clean rooms. We would stay again. Close to the subway lines.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Never had this happen before.People at front desk didn’t even look me in the eye with manager doing a horrible job explaining why...with one excuse being that ‘this happens a lot in Manhattan” (weak and wrong)Will never stay at a Hyatt again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt brand is always a good bet but the Hyatt Place in midtown will exceed your expectations. When I travel I try and stay at the Grand Hyatt or the Andaz in the Financial District because the rooms and gym are bigger, but I am never let down by the Hyatt Place when I midtown. The hotel is smaller, but the breakfast is a great added value and is actually tasty. In addition, the staff is what sets this hyatt apart from the other two. The staff is always welcoming and nice, which can make the difference in a stay.ThanksJon

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: great hotel, stayed for a week we don’t have any complaints, breakfast was average but good to start our day in The Big Apple. Front desk staff was very friendly and diligent. Hotel near subway station, ETB. We will stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For a budget hotel, this is pretty nice. Well located near several subway lines. Floor to ceiling window with stunning urban views. Good free breakfast for Hyatt members (tho the supermarket mini bagels are a disappointment). Walking distance to the flagship Macy’s in Herald Square and Pennsylvania Station (as long as you don’t have a lot of luggage).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have been coming to NYC for over 20 years and found this to be so conveniently located for my business needs in the City. I did not realize how close to Hearld Square, Macys, Penn Station, this was located. It also is close to Keens one fo the best Steakhouses in NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I used my Hyatt rewards points to stay at this hotel for one night because I was attending a company holiday party in the neighborhood. I was a bit skeptical of the location and possible noise in the area, however, the guest services was kind enough to move our room to a higher and quieter room. Checkout line was long... however I did the express checkout on-line and avoided the wait. Not the most glamourous hotel but if you just need a place to sleep the room was clean, quiet and comfortable, also there are plenty of inexpensive restaurants in the area and close to shops including the historic Macy's Herald Square.
user_name:
Liz_E881
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: we stayed for a week, nice rich breakfast free of charge to get you started in the morning not very common in the US especially in NYC.Big rooms compared to other hotels I have stayed at overall great city and good value for your money

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We arrived last Monday night and were checked in within literally one minute by the lovely Clarissa. We went out for dinner and when we came back to the room Clarissa had arranged complimentary wine and cheesecake with a note saying happy birthday! The room was pristine and has everything you could possible need. The rooms were serviced everyday to a very high standard.Unfortunately on our third day I got really sick in the middle of the night and ended up needing a Doctor. In the morning my mum, who I was travelling with, went down to reception and Michael sorted it right away and the Doctor came a short while later. Every time my mum went downstairs Michael was very attentive and made sure that I was ok and even helped getting extra herbal tea and salted chips as by night time this was all I could eat late at night. Sadly, on our last day my mum got sick too and it was no issue for the reception staff to let us have our room until our taxi arrived for a very minimal charge which we were so thankful for before a long journey home. This hotel was really 5***** on customer service. Thank you especially to Clarissa and Michael - you made out stay at Hyatt!xxI hope the hotel manager reads these comments and commends Clarissa and Michael as they went above and beyond and were so nice and caring towards us and an asset to your hotel! Thank you again Clarissa and Michael

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Five of us (all adults) stayed here for 6 nights and we all agreed we would definitely stay again! The room was very comfortable, with 2 double beds and a large pull out sofa bed. There was a fridge in the room, which was fantastic as it meant we didn’t have to go out and buy food every evening, plus tea & coffee making facilities were available. The breakfast at this hotel is simply fantastic, there’s no two ways about it! The selection on offer every day is incredible. Cooked food (scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes, waffles, hard boiled eggs, sausage, depending on the day), fresh fruit, oatmeal with tonnes of toppings, a huge selection of breads...something for everyone and it meant we were set up very well for the day ahead! There is also coffee available in the lobby throughout the day.When it came time to go home, the computers in the lobby allow you 15 mins of internet and the ability to print boarding passes etc, with no additional charge. We found this a really excellent facility!The staff were so friendly and helpful throughout our stay, no matter what the request! Thank you all for a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great smaller hotel centrally located to everything in Midtown. The entire staff went out of their way to make you feel like you a "somebody" in a big city. Kind of like Chik Fil A....."my pleasure" means a lot more than a mere "thank you and you're welcome" Great rooms and other amenities. I'll be back!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights. Checked in and out was fast. Hotel is right at midtown near times square and empire state building. Breakfast was ok simple with few selections. They have a gym but did not try it. They gave us complimentary bottled water and free wifi if you sign up for it’s membership for free. Will definitely recommend the hotel to my friends and family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel offered us great value and an excellent location. We walked to Times Square and to Macy's for their holiday windows and decorations. The subway was also very convenient. Bryant Park had a holiday art sale and that was just 3 blocks away. Lots of great shopping very close by. As a Hyatt member, we also got a full breakfast. The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.The room was exceptionally clean. You could hear sirens but that is the case anywhere in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is ideally located for 5 6 7 8th avenues Macys underground rooms spacious breakfast cooked or continental veggies all catered for,,,,, Staff excellent especially Michael for helping with flight check in and Wendy for sorting out our shuttle bus,,,, I am quiet hard of hearing and find it difficult talking on the phone thank you Hyatt on your staff excellence

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 5 nights for Christmas shopping from Black Friday. We were given room 2504 on the 25th floor facing the Empire State Building. What a view and easy access to roof top terrace on 26th floor. The breakfast was good and pubs shops all near to hotel. Close to Herald Square subway and also Penn Station subway. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location a few blocks from Herald Square and Penn Station - we took train to/from Newark Airport. High floor room was quiet. Smallish room, but fine for two people. Good complimentary breakfast. Helpful and friendly staff, who were able to check us in very early and provide good directions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Second stay at Hyatt Midtown - for location I dont think it can be beaten!! Anything you want - shops (Macys, Victoria Secret,’JC Penneys, GAP, Kmart etc) all just 3-5 minutes walk away. Restaurants and Irish bars galore on the street. Breakfast included every morning with a great selection between fresh fruit, cereal, porridge, pastries, breads, hot cooked breakfast, waffles/pancakes, tea/coffee etc all buffet style! My only small complaint from this stay is we were in an accessible King Bed room so I was on the sofa bed - once this is unrolled it makes passes from one side of the King Bed to the bathroom almost jmpossible without stubbing a few toes - and for my Mum in her mid 70s, the small gap between end lf sofa bed and end of King Bed made manouvering very hard. Also the sofa bed was extremely uncomfortable - and I am not a choosy traveller; hotels, hostels, b&bs, you name it i’ll stay there! For the last night I slept across the couch itself as that was a more comfortable option! However these were (for us) small quibbles but I could see the sofa bed layout design being an issue for others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for 9 nights the overall experience is great. It’s just the shower tile that needs to be renovated. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Susana always asked us when did we prefer to have our room cleaned, she did angreat job tidying the room. John and Marco did an excellent job in the breakfast area, even though sometimes it was chaotic with the amount of people, the did a great job maintaining the food fresh and the place clean. Everyone at the front desk iñwas also friendly and willing to help us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a royal Hyatt customer. The location of the hotel is excellent. With breakfast, it may not be a bad deal. Yet, it was too packed and chaotic at the breakfast area: limited manpower during thanksgiving, I guess. Overall ok, will be back ? Not sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place location was perfect. We were seconds away from the Macy's Day parade, 1.5 blocks from the subway and walking distance to Central Park. The hotel was very clean, staff was friendly and our room was quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great Hotel! excellent location, staff are very kind, very clean.Nice terrace for the Empire state building, a variety of food in the breakfast ! absolutely recommend this hotel and sure we will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My family and I were in town for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The location was perfect for this, as the hotel is just a half block away from 6th Ave (the parade route). It's also perfect for Bryant Park (2.5 blocks away), Herald Square (1.5 blocks away), Empire State Building, etc. It's just two blocks from the 34th St subway station (N-Q-R-W and B-D-F-M lines). The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and we received a room upgrade without asking based on World of Hyatt Discoverist status (this is NOT high-level status). The rooms were comfortable and fairly large by NYC standards. The included breakfast was the best I've had for one that is included with the room rate - very fresh fruit (not the old-looking fruit you often get), perfectly done eggs and oatmeal (not runny like you often get), and multiple other offerings - cereal, donuts, yogurt, bacon, muffins, etc. We loved our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: excellent location, great servcies, specious & clean rooms, very good and fast wifi, friendly staff, nice customer and Hyatt’s member care, late check out available, rich breakfast, warmly recommended
user_name:
atanasnaskok
Skopje, Republic of North Macedonia

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is perfect for midtown NY,in the middle of everything (Macy’s,Empire Building)Great size rooms stayed on 20th floor,very good service ,Breakfast was full of variety Definitely will return again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place midtown for a nearby wedding celebration. It was our first trip to New York. The location is great and easy to get anywhere in Manhattan in a reasonable time. The breakfast was excellent with a good selection. Staff very professional and caring. Many nearby restaurants and pubs. Would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: There was no heating in the room and it was extremely cramped. Would not recommend it to stay. Poor customer service but good location of the hotel. It’s also a very bad area! outside the hotel there are garbage bags everywhere! It’s not worth the money!
user_name:
Rowena518
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My first trip to nyc from the uk - a surprise from my wife and what a cracking hotel. We had a prime view of the Empire State Building from our room. The Hyatt staff were attentive and friendly, the breakfast selection whilst limited was still very good including cooked, cereals and fresh fruit (coffee was a bit strong for our liking but there are other drinks to be had! ) I didn’t use the gym but it looked quite clean. Location is great too, walking distance to broadway, time square, Central Park, subways and shopping! Rooms were a decent size and well equipped with a comfortable bed, sofa and clean bathroom. I would consider staying here again on my next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at this Hyatt Place for two nights. The location was perfect as we took the train to Penn station. It is a short walk to the hotel. It is also an easy walk to all the Broadway shows and midtown restaurants. The staff is friendly and works hard to make sure every guest is satisfied.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Cancellation is possible but you don't get your money back. €2200,- They are not willing to do anything and are very short with replying. They only spend time for you when they can get your money otherwise it is bye bye

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We’ve just got home to the UK following a truly wonderful stay.The hotel is in a great location, right in the heart of midtown, but just off the beaten track to make it feel homely. The hotel is beautifully kept, and you can see how proud the team are of their hotel.Our room was 2401, with a magnificent view of the Empire State Building and towards downtown. Our room attendant was Luz, and although English might not be her first language, she was a warm, friendly and very funny lady - always greeting you with “Good morning!”, she is a credit to the business.Breakfasts at the hotel were great and very good quality, the breakfast room does get busy over the weekends, but the team are regularly clearing tables so there’s never a wait for a seat.Special praise has to go to the front of house team - Clarissa, who is such a warm and friendly lady, David who helped us out with directions and metro maps and Michael who really went out of his way to make our stay so memorable.A huge thanks to the team who are true ambassadors of your brand, and helped to make two lost Brits feel right at home - we hope to be back!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt place is a well located hotel, very good for families and couples.Large bed in which you can sleep well.Very very good breakfast that changes every day, with a international choices.The staff is polite and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is always a great value and stay. I look for one wherever I travel. Always accommodating. The free bottled water was a very nice touch. Great location. Very easy to get to. See you next time

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Midtown Hyatt for an event at Madison Square Garden, about a 10 minute walk away. We also walked the 2 miles to the East Village without difficulty. The hotel had all the qualities of a typical Hyatt Place except, being a converted building in Manhattan, rooms and common areas were smaller. The breakfast area was also smaller and apparently there were lines at later hours. The staff was great, every request quickly handled. I appreciated that we were not charged for our third reserved night after we left a day early due to a medical problem. Be advised that breakfast is free only for Hyatt members who reserve on their website. It’s free to join the program. I’d definitely stay here again.
user_name:
JennJack
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were disappointed at our last stay here, but this one was even worse. They are now adding nuisance charges like the airlines. Breakfast deteriorated even more than last time - packaged donuts and mini muffins were like eating boxed and stale food. I actually didn’t even try as they looked so horrible.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: With so many accommodation choices in Manhattan I did lots of research and read many reviews. This hotel was perfect, from check in to check out our experience was marvelous. All the staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. We celebrated our 30th Wedding Anniversary and first time visiting NYC. Couldn't have been happier with our choice. Will definitely recommend and can't wait to come back. Thanks Michael, Annabelle, John and all the other super staff :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was exceptionally pleased with the location of this hotel and with the efficient use of space in my room, which was small but had everything I needed (desk, sofa, bed, closet etc). Everything was very clean and the bathroom and shower quite larger for such a small room. It did not bother me, but guests should be aware that a room on the third floor facing the street can be pretty noisy with night life in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place is a good, decent standard 3 star hotel. The room allocated was clean, modern fittings, a large and comfy bed and a good shower. The location is perfect for easy travelling around the city and very close to The Empire State BuildingThe room had a full sofa and footrest which dominated the space, a single chair and footrest would suit the standard rooms better in my opinion, allowing more space.Whilst accepting the building struggles for floorspace on each level, the breakfast room/bar is cramped and way too busy at peak times to enjoy a leisurely breakfast. To be fair, the hotel does advise of likely waiting times.Unfortunately the stark lighting in the room without windows does not help either.Not an easy solution to this, accepted, but judging by the reaction of fellow guests, our opinion was shared.The breakfast offer itself is exactly as expected and described for the hotel classification but plastic everything in terms of crockery, cutlery and glassware cheapens the brand, in my view.Despite that area of criticism it’s a decent budget hotel and if a good location, bed and shower are the priorities on your agenda, it fits the bill perfectly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I couldn't praise this highly enough. From the minute we arrived we were warmly welcomed by all staff from reception, dining, housekeeping and everyone in between. I was prepared for a cramped room given that alot of reviews on New York said to be warned for tiny rooms but we had a very spacious and spotlessly clean room. The bed was so comfortable after a days walking and sightseeing. The location was perfect..walking distance of almost everything and just 2 streets from the metro for the places you couldn't walk to. Our room had a large tv and fridge and safe, 2 seater couch and all other items you expect from a hotel. The en suite was clean and spacious. We had a rear facing room so no view except onto ac units of other buildings but we were not in the room for a view. We were out and about for that! 6 minute walk to the Empire State building and 10 minutes to Times Square. The buffet breakfast was all you could ask for....Cereals & porridge, yogurts & fruit, breads & muffins, tea/coffee and selection of juices , scrambled eggs daily with a different hot food each day ..sausages or bacon or potatoes etc. This was self service and plentiful. There was a 24 hour food menu reasonably priced and snack food available to buy at reception but we ate out during the day. The computer in reception with use of the printer was free to use and very useful to print our boarding passes. Free wifi in bedroom was excellent. The observation balcony on floor 26 is worth a visit. I can assure anyone reading this review I am in no way associated with the Hyatt hotels i am just a very satisfied customer. I will definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: From the moment we checked in- staff was wonderful! Super friendly. Our room was huge for NY standards and bathroom was great. Loved the location. Close to Times Square. Noise kept to minimum. Subway stations all around. Food and drinking right next door. Price was right and wonderful free breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place in general is a brand I love. Good value, comfortable, modern room decor and breakfast included. It is a standardised product but a good one. This ticked the boxes and was true to the brand. Flew into and out of Newark so easy to get the train to Penn and walk to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The proximity to Penn Station was ideal for our trip to visit friends and family.We can always expect the best in comfort and cleanliness for a good night's sleep and pleasant stay. Love the option for a late check-out as a world of Hyatt member.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The two beds were horrible. Yes, they gave us queen beds as promised, but each bed was placed on top of a regular sized bed frame. So the edges of the beds sloped downward. This made it very difficult to sleep. The room was incredibly cramped. For the high price (which was higher than originally appeared on the website), totally unacceptable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booked flight and hotel through Expedia, location of hotel is perfect for exploring the city, many places are within walking distance but the hotel is also very close to a subway station (we bought a 7 day unlimited metro card). We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and were given a room upgrade on the 21st floor overlooking the Empire State Building, as Hyatt Loyalty members, we had complimentary breakfast each morning which was superb. Roof terrace on the 26th floor has amazing views of the city. Our room had a coffee maker, shampoo etc provided and was perfect for us, will look to stay here again on our next visit.We had a City Sightseeing pass which gave us entry to 6 attractions, used it for 9/11 museum, Top of the Rock, One World Observatory, Ridley’s believe it or Not, a meal at an Italian restaurant (Bella Napoli) and Circle Line Landmarks Cruise, the pass cost €120 each (normally €150 but had a 20% discount plus a voucher for €40 which we used to book Empire State tickets), we saved over €100 with the card but the fast track entry for certain attractions didn’t always work.We got rush tickets for School of Rock on Broadway, you just need to be at the theatre about 45 minutes before they open the box office, we got front row tickets for a top Broadway show for €39 each. We visited the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island but booked these months before our trip so that we could go up in the crown of the statue.On our last morning we went to Central Park and also took a carriage ride, we negotiated a price for a 50 minute ride at the entrance to the park at 72nd street, the driver Brian was friendly and told us much about the park and the surrounding streets, he even had carrots so we could feed Magic the horse at the end of the ride.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My family and I stayed for two nights and loved it. The front desk staff were all exceptional! The location is perfect for anything from Times Square to Central Park. The included breakfast was a surprise as it was a full buffet not your typical muffin and cereal. I am a Hyatt member so the price I paid was reasonable given the location I’m not sure what the non member price is but nothing on the city is cheap so considering the price included breakfast, WiFi and reasonable parking and my family of five could stay in one room it was a good value!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I understand that it is very difficult in NYC to find a good hotel with a good price, BUT the price of 1500 $ for two person for 4 nights does not correspond to the name of the hotel And to its services . Location is perfect. Staff is very friendly.Breakfast is very poor, no fresh berries for oatmeal, only bananas and apples were available, plastic tableware and what I don't like at all - place where the breakfast was organized - no windows at all and it looks like low level canteen. It is Absolutely not a real " Hyatt " hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Where do i start? The staff is amazing--they all know my name. The rooms are a great size for NYC, the gym is small but functional. The location is to die for--not on the main tourist path so no crowds, but the people that stay there seem to be an international crowd which is cool. Join the Hyatt club and get free breakfast (it's good). And tons to do around the hotel. I come to NY on business a lot and this will be my default place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is in a perfect location for a vacation in NYC. Short walk to times sq. and right next to subway. Room is good, however a bit small for a family of 5 persons. Great breakfast makes a good start to the day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location:Is really good. Located in a fairly quiet street just between Broadway and 5th Street. You can really walk around to everything. We did not buy subway unlimited 7 day cards for our 5 day stay, and good for that - think we only used the subway 3 times.Room:We had booked through booking.com and I had written directly to the hotel and requested a high floor and view of Empire State and we got a room on the 16th floor with the most beautiful view of the Empire - it was so nice. The room had 2 double beds and a sofa bed, so our whole family with 4 children (ages 11-17) could be in the room. It worked fine, of course, it was a bit cramped when the sofa bed was turned off, but it was only during the night. We slept brilliantly and did not hear much about the street noise. The bathroom had a bathtub and it is really good when you are in a big city and goes a lot around. It is nice to relax there in the evening.Breakfast:There was never trouble for us 6 to find a free table in the morning. The selection of food was great and we found the quality to be fine. The only small wish from us would be that there was bacon several days. Unfortunately, it was only 1 day and when you come from a bacon eating country like Denmark, it's hard to miss especially on your vacation.Staff:Always sweet and friendly, fast checkin and the online checkout was super.Ideas:There is a really nice roof terrace on the 26th floor which is not really used to anything. What about doing a little outdoor SPA? A hottube pool would be great to sit in.Love to come again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Bed and room was amazingly comfortable and very spacious. Nice viewing floor at the top with great views of the Empire State Building only a couple of blocks away.Recommended for anyone seeing the sights in New York. Close to 34th street subway station too.
user_name:
Paul E
Derby, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We are always happy with Hyatt. Rooms were exactly what we expected and breakfast was very nice. Great Coffee so thank you for that! We will be back and thrilled to be a part of a good company. We have been members of Hyatt for a few years and happy to always look for one to stay in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a Hyatt member and this was the worst Hyatt I have ever stayed at. The location is great and the breakfast is good but that’s about it.I arrived in the evening and the first room I was given had a really bad smell so they gave me a different room which as well did not smell great. At that point I was too tired to move again so I stayed. The next day I went to buy febreeze to cover that smell.In addition to that, there was a brown stain on the carpet, the bedsheet had a dark stain, there were hair in the shower, something dark in the toilet that wouldn’t go away and a mouldy shower curtain. So all in all I would say not a clean place to stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Best location and walking distance to everything. Wonderful breakfast included in the price and super, helpful front desk operations. Was upgraded to a view room and recognized as a Hyatt Member. Eddie was so congenial and full of great advice and tips to make our short stay so perfect. We will stay here every time we visit the big apple; MAHALO

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Business travel...we use Hyatt.Personal travel...we use Hyatt.Family travel...we use Hyatt.We have never been disappointed coast-to-coast or overseas in the brand. Properties are a great value and the staff has always been first rate. Nice job Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location in Midtown Manhattan. Walking distance to Macy's, Penn Station. Room had a bulls eye view of the Empire State building. Staff is extremely nice. Good breakfast buffet and Seattle coffee.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at this property from Sept 13-18, 2018. We enjoyed every moment of our stay at this hotel. Every good place you want to see or visit in town is within a close range, mostly walkable distance. Just to mention a few like Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Time Square, Macys'( Biggest Store in USA), Statue of Liberty. The room was very good with a beautiful view and other facilities. The morning buffet breakfast was just too good. Therefore for us everything was so good.
user_name:
Sarbjit Singh S
Los Angeles, California

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location if you like to be in the middle of the heart of NYC. Very close to Herald Sq and a few blocks from MSG and Times Square.The room's size is really ok for NYC standards and the breakfast was very good considering the hotel's category.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I chose Hyatt Place New York Midtown South for the cost and location and was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and comfort. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Manhattan and this is one I plan to return to.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location in the heart of Manhattan , expensive for what you get but that's New York I guess . The Breakfast which is included in the price is average to poor at best, the eggs are the eggs you are having when your not having eggs , where do they get eggs that colour? . Be prepared to clean your own table and place your dishes in the bins cos nobody else will . The coffee is atrocious but that's because we are from a city with excellent coffee.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Check in process was smooth.Breakfast is very good.Room was clean but could use an additional mirror.Bed was comfortable.Room was quiet.Elevators ran smoothly.Parking garage is within walking distance and has a small discount with the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: All of the desk staff was VERY nice and smile all the time. Kenneth the door man is AWESOME from when we first arrive and every time we came back to the hotel he always greeted us with a BIG smile and is very cheerful. The location of this hotel is prefect!!! You are close to times square and lots of restaurants, we walk a lot except when we needed the subway which there are several in the area. Hotel is clean and updated, we did not see any housekeepers but our room was always clean and we had fresh towels everyday. Like most hotels in NY the rooms are a little tight but it was comfortable. I will stay here again!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Rooms were clean and well appointedBathroom was excellent though we found hot water took ages to flow in afternoons/eveningsStaff are helpful and friendly Breakfast weas great quality and varietyLocation is excellent 10 min walk to Times SquareTrucks collecting Rubbish overnight we’re a little noisy if your room is on 36th St

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed our stay here. The front desk staff were very friendly, cheerful and helpful. Also we really enjoyed the breakfast. The breakfast buffet had something to satisfy everyone. Great central location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Would stay here again. Rooms were good size for Manhattan. Staff was very accommodating and helpful. Location was great! Breakfast was ok but free.... nice if you want something light before heading out. Viewing deck from 26th floor was a very nice bonus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here for three night and would thoroughly recommend it. Rooms are spacious and clean, the included breakfast is very nice and the location is great. A couple of bars within 100metres where you can watch sport or have a meal, walking distance to Times Square and close to subway station.Staff are very helpful with good local knowledge and friendly.Great all round value and thoroughly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed there overnight before a cruse vacation. I booked a 5 ppl room and the room was big and spacious (may be because it was an accessible room). The big window allows me to see the Empire State Building clearly in the day and night. 10 mins walk to the Times Square. Walking distance to shopping malls, restaurants and convenient stores. Free continental breakfast and complimentary bottled water. Bathroom is basic and simple. No bathtub but I am okay with it. Clean!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A nice hotel in the middel of it all. Nice and welcoming staff. Clean rooms with a very good bed and pillows, with is important for a good sleep. Choose a room on the hugger levels, and facing Empire State building. If you are a member of club Hyatt, wich is free, you get a free bottle of water every Day. We will return another time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a regular Hyatt hotel guest. I will not be staying at this property again. This was my second visit there. Both times I had a similar experience. The rooms are tiny and feel very cramped claustrophobic. The natural lighting is very bad. There are much better hotels in New York City for the price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Starting with 3 bubbles for an average room an hotel, I take away 1 bubble for the shower, no regulation of volume and direction, no handshower, and if you are not clever enough, you will inevitably start with a cold shower. Now, 1 plus-bubble for cleanliness and breakfast included (although quite average). 1 plus bubble for the excellent location, makes 4 bubbles. I could stop there, but I gladly add 1 last bubble for really exceptional service when our plane was much delayed, and we waited many hours in the reception.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a no frills hotel with all the basic amenities. If you need something they will help. It is clean and comfortable. I stay here 2 weeks out of every quarter fro biz travel and am not disappointed. They are very generous with points also and the staff is great to work with. The hotel is centrally located so if you are in town on pleasure a lot is walking distance and the rest you can get to on the subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I spent some time thinking about the sort of review to write for this case, as there were positives and negatives. Hence the 3/5.Firstly the price is fine, given the location it is expected to pay $250+ for a room. In any other city I would say this isn't value for money but this is Midtown NYC so it is expected.In terms of location, you can't ask for better. The ESB is right around the corner, and there is a perfect view from the 26th floor balcony. One more than one occasion we bought lunch nearby and ate on the balcony just to enjoy the view. The staff there are very friendly and helpful. We were visiting for a special occasion and were treated to a small red wine and fruit bowl from the management team which was a lovely gesture!There are negatives however. Firstly from reviews I read it appeared that staying on a higher floor will reduce the sound of the outside noise. We were on the 21st floor and heard everything! They must have to look into more adequate sound proofing as the lack of a good night sleep was annoying. Also the mini-fridge in the room made a lot of noise too - so I plugged it out for the trip for some peace.Maybe a 3 is harsh as there are some positives, however all I use a room for is sleeping and when you are unable to get a good night sleep because of the noise outside it deters from the experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location! it's not on the main street so the noise level is acceptable as in the busiest city in the world. You get free ear plus in the room. Very friendly & helpful staff as Hyatt Place always stands for. I enjoy the complimentary coffee & hot tea all day long to ease the hustle & bustle NYC vibe. Yes I've mention the location again and it's about 20 mins walking distance to the Javits Center to attend the trade show. Will def return during my next business trip in the city. You know there's complimentary breakfast at Hyatt Place and I like it the dining area is super clean and quite roomy to accommodate most guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great facility for the price and ideal for its location in NYC. Easy access to public transportation including easy walking to a number of locations including Broadway productions. Reasonable rates for a Hyatt Place in the City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, friendly staff, good breakfast buffet (included), Stayed before and will stay again! Area is being revamped with other bars and restaurants so more to do. Easy walk to any place.My only point about the hotel is about a problem that was in the clean up, when a room maid got rested, the substitutes did not clean the room correctly and was important because in room had 4 people.But I want to compliment, congratulate DAVID, he was fantastic and very attentive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is great. It was a family vacation. We stayed there for 3 days. The hotel is clean and looks new. I've got a room on the 17th floor with a view of Empire State Building. There is a nice terrace on the 26th floor with some good views. Breakfast was fabulous, lots of to choose from. Even my picky daughter found something she liked. The stuff is friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is just fabulous,stayed 8 days in September and we were there for the heat wave,the room had air con so was kept nice and cool.a big thanks to all the staff for making our stay just simply the best.breakfast was beyond great something for everyone and they made the best scrambled egg.we had a room on the 25th floor and fab view of the awesome Empire State Building from our bed.the viewing area on 26th floor was even better.everywhere was kept spotlessly clean a big thanks to the cleaners and housemaids fab job by all.again I can’t recommend this hotel enough.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, friendly staff, good breakfast buffet (included) and very clean / comfy room! Stayed before and will stay again! Area is being revamped with other bars and restaurants so more to do. Easy walk to Penn Station!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel room was large by New York standards. Breakfast had plenty of fresh fruit options. The only item was room was too hot and did not cool down enough with the AC. If you are in the midrange hotel category, the ability to control your own temp is a must. Room was also lacking a box of facial tissue which was odd. 26th floor had a good view of Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was just as expected. I communicated with the AGM Kyle several times and he is nothing but professional and welcoming. I am a hotel manager in DC and I am normally critical of chain hotels, but they did a good job. Also shout out to John in the kitchen who is really a great employee. He went out of his way to help me and I also seen him helping multiple people on a very busy Labor Day morning. He literally saw me stuggling with a chair and came to help without me even asking, he also showed me how to work the microwave when he realized I couldn't figure it out. Good job.
user_name:
Zachary D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is my 4th stay at the hotel and now I feel it's home. Things I like, basic, neat, small and cosy, unlike the Grand Hyatt whose lobby is full of people and it seems more like a shopping mall than a hotel! Staff at the reception has been friendly and polite. Smooth check in and check out. Jonathan, seemed to be working hard, morning noon and night and it seemed he never left the desk! Location is great, don't miss the 26th floor, a great view of the empire state building! Overall a comfortable stay .
user_name:
Aditi06
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were in newyork for first weekend in November for a cousins wedding. It was the wife's first trip to new york so we decided to stay in city to make the most of our short trip. The location of this hotel is fantastic. Walking distance to Bryant park, times square. The room was quite spacious compared to typical new york hotels. The hotel staff was friendly and welcoming. The room was clean and as usual the hyatt bed in my opinion is the best among all hotel groups. we were very happy with the hotel. the hotel staff also offered us a complimentary late checkout which was quite generous of them. No complaints at all and highly recommend the hotel to all travelers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place on W36 in NYC in the heart of the Garment District. Great central location for NYC, clean hotel and service was excellent. I specially enjoyed the friendliness of John, one of their 24/7 employees. Ironically my stay was leading up to Labor Day and this guy works too much. Whatever, I was looking for, John was the man! Very knowledgeable and accommodating. Definitely recommend the Hyatt Place for location, rooms and service of staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for week with 4 adults (2 rooms). The location is very good, on walking distance from metro stations, Broadway and Times Square. Friendly hotel staff. Rooms were comfortable but not always impeccable cleaned. Unfortunately one of the rooms faced a broken airco. Although we reported this at front desk before breakfast it was still not repaired when we returned in the evening, so some room for improvement to follow-up issues :-)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect Midtown location where I used to stay at the Sheraton Russell on Park Av but this hotel no longer exists.Minimal service but friendly and effective staff. Large room, simple decor but very well equipped. Excellent bed, slept very well.Very good breakfast buffet offering many choices. Very pleased that I stayed here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Friendly and helpful staff, clean room, and great location in the heart of New York City. Extremely close to major attractions and the subway/metro. Amazing rooftop balcony with great views of the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Everyone was very nice and helpful when we checked in. We were meeting friends who were late and put notes on their account to let them know what was going on. They gave us directions to where we needed to be. They were friendly even when we kept checking about our friends. I would stay there again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location for sightseeing, seeing Broadway shows and shopping in Manhattan. Hotel very clean and staff, particularly front desk, very welcoming and helpful. Breakfast bar excellent in both selection and quality of choices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We felt that the room was well set out as there was room for a 3 seater lounge and footstool. So good to have somewhere comfortable to sit. The bed was very comfortable and the room had all the usual extras - air-con, safety deposit box, ironing facilities, free toiletries etc. Breakfast was good but not a whole lot of room so it is best to be early or you can take it to the foyer or your room to eat. There is an outdoor viewing area on the 26th floor and the Empire State Building is almost next door. Lots of food places nearby. The staff were friendly and helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Friendly staff. Great view of ESB from 18th floor room. Terrace on 26th floor lovely at night. Plenty at breakfast but gets very busy around 7:30am. Gym decent and clean. Rooms are tidied most days. USB port charger by bed

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have been in similar price range hotels in NY, and they have been nicer thanbthe Hyatt Place. It is all about details. In the others hotels they have free bottle of water in your room everyday and coffee/tea station the 24 hours. Also the shampoo and conditioner are quite not good.I got a room on the 20th floor street view. It should have great but the window glass was all dirty with stains.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice hotel with a good breakfast. The hotel is located in midtown which is a good area to start exploring Manhattan and only two blocks north of Empire State Building. It is good to be early for the breakfast because it can be really crowded later in the morning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is our first visit to NYC with our kids. We usually visit NYC once a year as a couple.We booked this hotel with our Hyatt credit card points.I would like to preface that as a Hyatt Place, we are not expecting luxurious accommodations.Pros:1) Free breakfast from 7am-10am2) Close to Empire State Building and Time Square3) Surrounded by affordable places for quick bites. Korean town is nearby.4) Nice terrace with Empire State Building view.Cons:1) Elevator is small and therefore takes a while to accommodate everyone who needs to go anywhere 2) Rooms are small, only 1 mirror. This is a con if you have 2 adults and 2 kids vying for a mirror :)3) Charges $3 per luggage if you would like them to hold it for you before your flight.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good solid , clean and friendly hotel overall.Best feature was the roof top terrace which I think could be made a bit more of a feature— with amazing views of the Empire State.Good mid town location.Breakfast is included which was good, with a varied selection— but very busy and limited seating.VERY irritating “hotel policy” regarding left luggage. I’ve stayed at dozens of hotels over the years, but never had to pay $3 per bag at checkout to leave an item whilst spending time in the city before heading to the airport. Furthermore the luggage was not left in a secure room, and the ticket receipt stated that’ the hotel was not liable for loss or theft’.A slightly sour end to our NY break.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We arrived at the hotel at lunchtime and our room was not ready, which we expected and this was fine. On our return at 3pm (check in time), the room was still not ready so we waited a short time in the reception. When our room was allocated, we had paid for a room with a view but we decided that a room on a lower floor would be better for us and therefore, we opted for a different (cheaper) room. Although we had paid for a better room, we accepted that this was our choice and we did not give the fact that we had down graded a second thought. The staff at check-in were very helpful and polite.The room was absolutely fine and the breakfast was good with a range of choices. The best thing about the Hyatt was the terrace on the 26th floor, the hotel should consider doing more in this area i.e. more comfortable seating - it's a great space!We stayed in the Hyatt for 4 nights. Unfortunately, our experience was spoilt at the check-out stage. When we requested to leave our bags until we were due to leave NY at 3pm, we were told that there was a $3 charge per bag. As we are a family of 5 with hold and cabin bags each, this added up and was an unexpected expense - this fee does not apply on arrival. I told the receptionist that this was something that I had not experienced before (despite staying in hotels in many major cities) and the response was 'it's hotel policy, nothing to do with me.' Reluctantly, we had to agree to this basically, we had little choice. Stickers were attached to the bags and we were given a receipt. At this point, I made the receptionist aware that it seemed very out of balance that when we arrived to check-in at 3pm, the room had not been ready (which we did not make a fuss about) and we had opted for a lower grade room for our 4 night stay (yes, our choice but this was advantageous to the hotel as we'd paid for one of the higher priced rooms which was then available for other guests). The receptionist looked at me, rolled her eyes and continued to do what she was doing at the desk. There was absolutely no verbal response. Given the fact that there are a few trip advisor reviews that negatively comment on this $3 bag charge, I suspect this issue comes up with some regularity so plenty of opportunity for staff to develop a response more appropriate than rolling the eyes and ignoring the guest when they speak. I have contacted Hyatt directly about our poor check-out experience and given the name of this member of staff.Last but not least, it is important for other potential guests/guests to be aware that the baggage store is essentially the dining room which is part of the publicly accessible area which is out of sight of the reception desk. I mentioned above that guests are given a receipt for their bags which states on the reverse (pic added for info): "In consideration of the free storage of the property covered by this check, the owner or person depositing same agrees: This establishment is not liable for the theft, loss, damage or destruction of the property in the absence of gross negligence on the part of this establishment or its employees."So essentially, guests are paying for their bags to be stored (despite the receipt saying free) in a public area which can be accessed by anyone, at anytime and the hotel is not liable if anything is stolen or lost! I should mention that we collected our bags ourselves from the dining area, changed for our flight in the reception toilets and were waiting for our taxi to collect us before a member of the reception staff asked if we had the receipt for our bags. There were a number of bags/suitcases in the dinning area and clearly, anyone with untoward intentions could either remove a bag or potentially, and more worryingly, leave something in the public area of this hotel. Hyatt please take note, your policy on baggage storage requires review both the charge and the practices around storage.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for 2 night and the experience was one of the best I’ve ever had. The hotel was clean and staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Despite being busy, there was plenty of food at breakfast and the staff was quick to clean tables and provide help. Overall one of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel has a great location, allowing easy access to subways which will get you where you need to go quickly. The room was clean and quiet. The shower was wonderful. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. They provided ready service and answers to our questions, such as restaurant suggestions and the quickest way to get to our destinations. Special kudos to Julie, who works the afternoon/evening shift.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel has a great location but we traveled as a family of 4 with a 2 and a 5 year old and there are definitely better suited hotels than this one. the front desk was super slow. We got to the city about 12pm and figured our room wasn’t ready but checked anyways, it wasn’t o big deal, but we confirmed we needed a crib and would like a high floor (as we heard lots of complaints of street noise on low floors) so we checked our bags and went out for the day. Came back at 5pm, past checkin time assuming everything would be ready and id just be handed a key but it took the front desk forever to confirm they had a crib and then 30 min later we finally got our key, crazy it took that long. The rooms are clean and good size for NYC we had two beds and the crib fit easily as well. The next morning about 9ambreakfast was packed so we had to sit in the lobby as there was no where else, they were replenishing as they ran out and there were lots of choices. As we left we asked for parking validation and they said they couldn’t find them.they looked for about 10min and finally just gave us a business card. Overall I have stayed at tons of Hyatt’s and this one just did not live up to the level of service all the others have had.
user_name:
JennDC28
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice mid size hotel. Friendly accommodating staff. Comfortable bed. Great location next to Keens Steakhouse and some great bars and restaurants . Reasonable price. Good shower. Perfect for a quick weekend getaway. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for 5 days. Room was very clean and comfortable. Location of Hotel was excellentt, close to everything. The Front Desk was excellent, very helpful. Provided information regarding what to see, transport and general information. Breakfast (included in Hotel price) was more than satisfactory. Will stay at Hyatt Place Midtown again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you want a comfortable stay, that is convenient and treated with the upmost respect, this is definitely the place for you! I truly enjoyed my stay and would definitely go back. The customer service was beyond epic here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Quick trip to NYC for a get away with our daughter and friends before starting senior year. Staff was amazing!! Very clean hotel and the breakfast was wonderful!! We will most certainly be back. Terrific location

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Spent approximately 13 months at this hotel on a weekly basis. It become my home away from while I was away on business and building my first home. Whether it was my 1st stay or my 50th stay, the staff was incredible. I cannot even put it into words. I’ve stayed at plenty of Hyatt properties but this one does a tremendous job representing the brand—hands down. Every aspect of every single stay went smoothly. Check-in? Never an issue. The room itself? Never an issue. The views? Amazing on both sides of the hotel. You can see Rockefeller Center from one side and the Empire State Building on the other. Overall location? Perfect. Restaurants in the area? Plenty of top notch places. If you’re traveling for business or leisure, you must consider this Hyatt Place. Next time I’m in the city for business or a visit to the city with my family, I’ll be staying there. I genuinely miss the place and the staff. Cannot wait to be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I had a wonderful stay in NYC. The hotel was centrally located. Easy walk to Times Square, the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue. Great restaurants nearby. all the front desk employees were wonderful and very helpful. The manager, Kyle, even wrote us a handwritten note and left it in our room. Location is a short walk to the subway. We attended a couple Yankees game, and it was a very easy and short walk to the sub station. Very impressed with the front desk, and customer service!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nestled in midtown you pretty much have close proximity to all the best sections of Manhattan. Being a very clean and comfortable hotel at a reasonable price is icing on the cake! The hotel staff were all very accommodating. The breakfast buffet was very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very simple great hotel, great location, excellent staff! Stayed 2 days on business found my room always clean and the staff very welcoming. Will stay here again on my next trip to the city. Would recommend if you need to be in this part of the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location - walkable to/from a lot of great Midtown things to see. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Don't expect a palatial estate but do expect the Hyatt Place quality and decor in a much smaller footprint. No parking on-site but the parking arrangement with a facility just down the block on the same side of the street made check-in and vehicle storage easy. Hotel seemed fully booked or close to it - lots of people in and out. Breakfast until 10AM was quite helpful - people much be sleeping in after a long night out? :-). But, if I were you, I'd get up early and beat the breakfast rush.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed our visit to New York and to the Hyatt. From the moment we talked with the staff on the phone to our arrival and departure the staff was consistently helpful. The breakfast was very good and more than we expected. The staff even gave us a special basket for our very special occasion with a warm welcome card. Though the rooms were very small and it wasn't a luxury hotel they dedication and professionalism and cleanliness of the place made the difference.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is very clean with a large shower, and the beds comfortable. Staff was friendly and accommodating. We stayed up too late and missed breakfast both mornings, but it is served until 10 a.m. Overall a great value for the money. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Being the cheapest option by far, the quality and customer service wasn’t sacrificed! The front desk agent would always remember us when we walked in and the room was always cleaned after coming back from a long day of sight seeing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location but very dirty rooms, old towels that were supposed to be white but looked gray. Some places on this building and the room look like they have not been cleaned in years. The people is very nice and the location very convenient but I could hardly sleep thinking that I had to take a shower the next day in a bathroom with such unclean conditions and use the disgusting towels provided by the hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My room face the empire state building. Really enjoyed the view. Staff was great, breakfast was better than any hotel breakfast I've had, lot's of options. Was in NYC for an event a Madison Square Garden, was maybe a 10 minute walk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
