It was a perfect central location with easy walking to shopping, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and the subway. Staff was always cordial and willing to assist or answer questions no matter how many times I asked them to confirm which way to Sixth Ave! Room was clean and comfortable and housekeeping did a superb job as well. We were in room 2001 with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building and the rooftop terrace was a plus! We read reviews mentioning the speed of the elevators but in our four night stay I think there was only a single occurrence where that seemed to be noticeable, and seeing as how this was a busy December weekend I believe the hotel had to be full. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Having stopped on Times Square on our last visit we felt Herald Square, nr Macy’s would be a different and cheaper option. The hotel looks very new and we were quickly checked in. Although there are 26 floors there only appears to be 8 rooms on each floor. We were really surprised how big the room was for NYC, plenty of storage space, Safe, King Bed, Sofa, tea, coffee, ironing board and iron. The bathroom was also large with a great walk in shower. We were on the 7th floor and slept well for our 4 nights, no noise issues.Plenty of people moan on here about the breakfast- I cannot understand why. It’s free, it has a massive array of items and a different hot option everyday such as bacon, sausage, egg, French toast, pancakes and there are signs everywhere, including in the lifts telling you at what times it gets busy. We went once when it was busy and after a short wait got a seat. The rest of the time we went around 8 am and got a seat without issue. The staff replenish the breakfast continually and there is a good choice of cereals, breads, doughnuts, fresh fruit salad and porridge. If you don’t like queues go early. For nyc I thought this was a great extra at no cost.Reception staff were really helpful and you could buy drinks, alcohol and food from them if you wished. They also stored your luggage in a secure room upon checkout.The hotel is close to the subway and herald square which is approx 3 mins walk away. The price we paid was around £165 a night which again for NYC including breakfast was excellent.I will happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Visited Times Square to see Rockafeller Xmas Tree Lights, Lord & Taylor light show, & great food at Juniors Restaurant & Bakery, Capital Grille, & Keen Steakhouse. U got to ltry Juniors cheesecake/ it is the best!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is fine other than the breakfast area. The tables are not correct for the space and they are not arranged properly. Guests have to sometimes literally climb over seats to get to their seats.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Geat location- near subway and short walk to Bryant Park. Parking is very close (approx $50 overnight). Good selection for breakfast. Rooms are a good size. Only "complaint" is that the comforter is very light (more of a blanket) rather than a thicker/plush comforter you typically see.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Convenient location teamed with excellent service at a reasonable NYC price. Attended the Jimmy V. Classic short walk to Madison Square Garden. Go NOVA!!! Staff was extremely friendly and courteous. Would definitely book again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Last minute booking in this hotel was pleasantly surprised how good it was the hotel is in a quiet area 30 seconds to 5th Avenue 10 minutes times to Times Square 2 minutes to Macy’s 5 minutes to the Empire State the hotel was immaculate throughout room was a good size comfy bed and pillows great shower the room had everything apart from bathrobes and slippers the view out of the massive windows was out of this world breakfast was included in the room price a good selection of hot and cold items there is a bar onsite and plenty of restaurants outside and the staff were all welcoming would not hesitate to stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is located in a great location if you are bopping around Manhattan. I recently stayed a night for a business trip. The hotel was clean and the king room was a good size. The staff was very friendly. I would stay again and have recommended this hotel to some friends who will be traveling to New York soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a good choice in an interesting area (Murray Hill, Near the Morgan Library). Property is pretty bland and "corporate" but clean and proximate to everything (transport, good bars/restaurants, shopping, etc).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is in a great location if you're traveling in midtown Manhattan. It is an easy walk to all of the "typical" sites, as well as Grand Central and Penn Station. The staff is friendly and efficient. The best part is that they offer a great breakfast every day, so there is no need to find a restaurant in the morning. The cost of the room is fair.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect hotel for our group of 5 who came to NYC for a girls vacation! Plus the free hot breakfast was an added bonus too! Food was great and different each morning! Location was great and convenient to Times Square and Rockefella Plaza. Definitely recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights during our recent trip to New York and there is absolutely nothing I can fault about this place. It’s very central, about a 6-10 min walk to Times Square, right across the street from Macy’s and close to a subway for attractions such as 9/11, Brooklyn bridge etc. Breakfast was included and it really surprised me. We weren’t expecting much just a continental type spread but there were eggs, bacon, pancakes etc every morning, only advice here is to try get down early as it does fill up as the morning goes on and can be hard to get a table etc. The beds are very comfy and the rooms are spotless. There is a rooftop viewing point that looks straight out onto the Empire State Building which at nighttime looks amazing from here. And to top it all off the staff are super friendly and accommodating. Would highly recommend and will definitely be staying here again if we go to New York!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice and cozy place two blocks away from the Empire State Building. There are rooms with direct view to ESB. Unfortunately I didn't get one of those but anyhow I enjoyed my stay at Hyatt Place. The closest subway station, Herald Square is like 5 minutes walk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you want something simple, quick and efficient...this is the place for you. Super convenient and super informative staff! The terrace in the front is a nice touch to just sit and people watch. Small Starbucks inside the hotel is good. Bed is very comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this property in September for business - on the second evening of our stay the glass shower door exploded while my husband was in the shower - he was cut on his feet, legs, chest, and ear (since our stay we have seen numerous accounts of these shower doors exploding and injuring people) I do not want to get into the specifics of the evening this happened - I will just say that we were frightened by this and confused as to how this could have happened - once I got my husband out fo the shower (glass and blood all over) we phoned downstairs to the desk - 2 people, no one in management, came to,our room - they brought a mop and one bandaide - they were nice but not equipped to deal with the situation - the gal went back down and got more first aide equipment - the custodian began cleaning up - we did not go to a hospital as we were visiting and had lots of work to do for our business and choose to get the bleeding to stop and sterilize the areas and get the wounds covered up - my husband felt he could handle it and did not want to get caught up.in a city hospital - we were moved to a new room without a glass shower door - we stayed 2 more nights as we had business to conduct that can only be done during this period in the city - I ran all over the city for my work the next two days while my husband took it easy staying close to the room since he had pain in his feet from the cuts when he walked too much - needless to say this affected our business stay in the city - never once during the rest of our stay did anyone in management inquire how my husband was or ever even apologize for this situation - upon checkout we asked to talk with a a manger and were told he was in meetings so no one was available - we got our bill we were charged 100.00 for the evening the door exploded and the other 3 nights charged regular price - again never an apology from anyone - we requested a copy of an incident report - the report stated what was told to the manager by the young gal that come to our room after the incident - we were never asked about our understanding of the events - the craziest thing on the report is they stated they moved us to a new room and we were happy with the view - it was night time and dark out - we were told by the gal it had a good view but we were so shaken and just hoping that my husbands cuts stopped bleeding that we were not focused on a view - we took the report paid for our stay and left very bewildered on how we could be treated so badly and with such lack of respect or regard - when I got home I contacted the Hyatt and was eventually rsponded to by the asst manager - he said he would see what he could do to make things better, please give him a few days - after a week of no contact back from him I sent a letter saying how amazed we were at such poor customer service and such disregard and disrespect for us as guests - we decided to dispute it through,our credit card - it is in dispute - we are 55 and 59 year old adults that come to the city 4 to 5 times a year for business and are gone all day for work, we sleep and shower in our room and that is about it - the managers response to the credit card company was we were rough with the room and cost them 4 nights of a guest paying while they had the shower door fixed , I am amazed that he has never had a concern for his guest - we were not rough, this door was not safe and was defective - once again no contact from him and no apology or care for the guest - I am amazed at the poor customer service and absolutely no management of any kind in this facility - a simple apology and asking if my husband was okay would have made such a difference - I have to say that I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone if there was ever any type of emergency or anything that needed management attention, the management is non existent in this building and it is not even present by email - the shower door exploded it was not due to anything my husband did - please read about how common these situations are - the management choose to blame us for a defect - we have stayed all over without incident, I have never written a review before but feel compelled to share this very sad and horrible experience at this hotel - I hate to write anything negative on a one time experience but this is a severe lack of management and lack of safety and I question the judgement of the management at this hotel - maybe this will get a response from the manager - I own a business so I am acutely aware of decent and respectful customer service , neither of which we received from this management - Kendra Yale

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was great good location I stayed here for 4 days, the breakfast was ok and elevator was sometimes slow that not all you are charging me 2x much for the room! When I check my card you charge me 24. Nov and 27.nov!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Theater just a few blocks away, Macy's across the street, subway around the corner, a wonderfully located Hyatt quality hotel. It is very convenient to have breakfast available. Having a sofa in the room is a plus, not having to always sit on the bed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: One of the best hotel experiences we've had which for New York was surprising. We went New York to see the parade and chose the Hyatt because it was close to the parade route. It is also close to the subway which made traveling around easier.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is nice and clean. It isn't amazing by any means but for the price it is a nice hotel. The rooms are small but the beds are very comfortable. We had a view of Empire State Building. Breakfast is included in the hotel and was your basic free hotel food. It wasn't fancy by any means but it did the job for my family of 5. The only bummer is it doesn't have a place to do your laundry.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Myself and 5 others stayed at this hotel during our 5 days in newyork city. The hotel is in an excellent location, 10 min walk to times square and a two minute walk to Macy's! Hotel was clean and considering there were 3 to a bedroom we had plenty of space . The view of the empire state building was wonderful .. the bed was comfortable , and the pull out sofa bed also ! ( maybe a thicker blanket for the pull out bed is needed, one thin blanket wasn't enough.. but the hotel did give another one when we asked .. duvets are needed during winter months as we were cold during the night.. that is my only criticism).. the free breakfast was excellent plenty of choice .. hot breakfast and an excellent selection of bread, jam ,cereal , fruit , yogurt and unlimited tea and coffee .. if i ever return to the wonderful city of New York I will return to this hotel. Thank you for a lovely stay x

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We chose Hyatt Place as they sleep up to 6 in a room, provides complimentary breakfast and WiFi. Location is also very central. Easy to get to 34th street metro station, and short walk away to Broadway.We requested and received a room with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. Although rooms are not big, it’s sufficient for the 5 of us. Beds were very comfortable and my 9 year old son slept very comfortably on the sofa bed too.Complimentary breakfast was of very high quality. We enjoyed the different hot breakfast bowls on offer daily. Also yoghurt, fresh fruits, hot porridge, cereal and pastry for those who prefer a lighter breakfast. Coffee was good and tea (Tazo) came in many variety. We liked that a selection of milk was on offer too- skimmed, almond, etc.Must say that the lobby of the hotel always smells fresh and welcoming.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a gem, well=located with spacious rooms in a perfect location. Breakfast offers a wide variety and is most welcome as a complementary feature, and staff is most welcoming. I would highly recommend this hotel for visitors to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was great but gym was small but usable n the basement. Breakfast was free and had several great options. Location is in midtown and a parking garage is on the same block. It is not cheap but considering the area of NYC, the price is expected.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First, let me say that the hotel room itself was fine, as were most of the staff. The breakfast looked better than it actually was, but acceptable. The reason for the 1 star rating is as follows: I needed to spend a week in Manhattan. As an Expedia rewards member, I found this hotel for under $200 a night, and decided to book it for two nights since I had never stayed there, and wanted to make sure it was as advertised and a reasonable walking distance from where I would be spending most of my days. When I received my confirmation by email a few minutes later, I realized they had only booked and charged me for one night. I immediately called the front desk, explained the error, and asked if they could make the correction. I was told that they would not be able to match the rate and that the rate had to be set through Expedia. I called Expedia, and THEY said they would have to call the hotel to get their permission to do so. The Hotel manager refused, and then Expedia informed me that they could not add a night, but would have to cancel my reservation ( at $200.00 / night ) and re-book it for 2 nights at $500 plus a night ! ( $1025 with tax, more than 5 times the advertised rate ) I asked the Expedia rep if she realized what she was asking me to do, got a moment of silence, then I refused, and kept the one night @$200.00, since they had already charged my credit card. I arrived at the Lobby and spoke with the manager. He said he was unable to help me since “rates are subject to change without notice.” I tried again the following morning, and would have been willing to accept some type of compromise, since we were already checked in. But there was absolutely no effort form management to even try to adjust the rate even though there was plenty of availability. The only response was “Sorry , our rates are subject to change.” I checked out and spent the rest of the week at a 4 star hotel 3 blocks away. It was like a classic “bait and switch scheme” which I would not have expected from a Hyatt Hotel. The next morning, while sitting at breakfast in my new hotel, I received an email from Hyatt, welcoming me to the “Hyatt Experience”. Really???

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location 10/10. Service 10/10. Plus these guys will pursue you if you don’t seam completely satisfied, till they get it right. Breakfast 5/10. Nothing wrong with the food. Just not a lot of choice. But all the staff are great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel very tired once on the floors and rooms. Unfortunately I had a bad experience with major partying going on in the room next door. Went on to the early hours, manager on duty was called at 2am, and went to the room requesting them to quieten down. 3am, continued, manager requests again, 4am, Manager asks them to leave the hotel which was great. What wasn't great was that there was no security and after they were evicted from hotel, came up the stairs back into the room after 4am and used their key cards again as the Manager did not take them off them. And to add to all that, was threatened by one of the party goers at the lift the next morning. As I was a women travelling alone, that was very freighting. Hotel were apologetic of course, and refunded my night, but is a serious issue when the party goers get chucked out of hotel only to be able to get right back in again. Breakfast was far not great at all, impossible to get a seat after 7.30am. Location was great. But sadly, due to the wear and tear of the hotel and security issues I won't be staying there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff was very friendly and nice. Upgraded my room as a Hyatt mid-tier member. Room was clean, bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. Location is very convenient and close to major attractions if you are going there as a tourist.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice hotel, clean. Friendly staff, accommodating, helpful with directions. Rooms were nice, good size, clean, we were on the top floor with an observation deck which was pretty cool. I will say we went down to breakfast at the end of when it was being served and with that being said, it was awful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: THis hotel was very nice, clean, customer friendly. Rooms were clean and had a view of the Empire State Building. It was close to everything, Time Square was about a 20 minute walk. Macy's nearby. Breakfast was good and had eggs, yogurt, oatmeal, fruit, juices, cereal, sausage, pancakes, etc. Staff was great, parking was down the street-self parking.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We planned our visit to NYC 5 months in advance & stayed for 8 days…after exploring many of the sites and restaurants we enjoyed the comfort of the hotel…the staff felt like a extended family…always willing to accommodate our requests and questions…Jonathan and David were very considerate…the location of the hotel was safe and provided easy access to walk about…take the subway…or catch a train…the variety of items offered for breakfast made beginning the day very easy…the excellent wi-fi connection provided easy access…we sleep very well…going forward we will always explore the option of staying at a Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is very centrally located to see much of what Manhattan has to offer.The service at the front desk was top notch. Jonathan Santos took the extra steps to make our stay special by remembering our names and likes. He is very pleasant to interact with.The rooms were quiet and well maintained.The breakfast included was better than most from this style of hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We cant say enough about how great this hotel was. The staff was over the top friendly and accommodating. Kyle, was so helpful with our wishes for room locations. Eddie and the rest of the staff at the front desk were so welcoming and social. Hotel was very clean and The location couldn't be more perfect for a trip to the city. We walked to shopping, restaurants and Central Park We highly recommend!Thanks,Mary S.
user_name:
Mary S
Colts Neck, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice staff and overall I had a nice stay. The only thing was the bathroom. Mold in shower and sink. The breakfast selection was great because it had a variety to select from. I would come to stay here again. I just hope they get the mold out of the bathrooms. Change those curtains!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A nice hotel close to penn station and the Empire State Building. Staff was very friendly and the complimentary breakfast was very good. Our room was on the 17th floor with window towards 36th street. Unfortunately we could hear a lot of street noice in our room.Windows need sound proofing? Besides that I can’t think of anything negative to say about the hotel. Would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Traveled as a family and we miraculously fit in a room good for 5-6 people. The room was a good size with comfy beddings. We just had a problem with the bathtub drain but it was fixed immediately by the hotel maintenance guy. Hotel offers free breakfast with good options (oatmeal, eggs, bacon, sausages, cereals, fruits and coffee/tea/juice). Location is great - there's a Shake Shack nearby which is open till 12 midnight, train station nearby, a block away from Herald Square, and walking distance to the NY Public Library, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station and Empire State Building. Service was great, staff were generally accomodating, fast wi-fi. Will stay here again next time? YES.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: You can't beat the location of this hotel. We did have some issues with the thermostat in the room and the bathroom vanity was kind of small for the 3 of us but all in all it was a very nice room with comfortable beds. We were very impressed with the breakfast. Many different choices and the food was very good - better than most hotels. We would definitely come here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was the second time in three years we have stayed at the Hyatt Place. We will always stay here on our visits to New York from the UK. Brilliant location, very competitive price by NYC standards,rooms ideal for our needs,staff very friendly and professional,breakfast each morning was very good. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel! Front staff was friendly and helpful. Angie was very nice checking us in . One young man we saw several times Jonathan santos always quick with a smile. He was courteous and made sure we had our questions answered and made our trip that much better. Great location, rooms are good size for New York rooms, clean, great breakfast. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Empire state, Madame Tussaud, Time Square and Subways are on walking distance, Free Breakfast, coffee and wifi are plus point. Bed is comfortable, bathrooms are nice and clean. Rooms are not much spacious, i found difficulty to enter with the Pram and not much space to keep the Luggage bags.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well located for Penn Station (8-10 minute walk) and close to Times Sq this budget Hyatt was more than acceptable to us for our two night stay. The room was large enough and the bathroom had all we needed Breakfast was more than good enough although it was a bit of a scrum getting a table

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a regular visitor to NYC and always like to try different Hotels, so chose Hyatt Place due to the location being one of my favourites, and the Tripadvisor reviews being favourable.Overall, the hotel is a perfect location, just a few minutes walk to landmark shopping (Macys etc) and very close to all the subway lines (34 St/Penn Stn). The area feels safe, and close to many places to eat. The rooms are clean, and for NYC a comfortable size. A favourable thing also is there are only a small number of rooms on each floor so you do not have to drag your bags down long hallways, and the chances of being disturbed by other guests is low, making it a quiet hotel. I did not notice any street noise at all, another plus as this is a common experience in New York Hotel rooms.I did not try the breakfast so can not provide insight into that, but I liked that they provided cards in the rooms that guided on when the best times were based on the times people use the facility.Unfortunately I did have issues, but the responsiveness to these has helped change my thoughts on this hotel. Housekeeping did not respond to my request for a Hairdryer - turns out it is in the drawer under the TV. The biggest issue I had was when I arrived parts of the carpet were saturated (apparently as a result of the storm that came through NYC that day), so I provided feedback to housekeeping who did try to remediate, however, when I returned to the hotel mid afternoon to find a carpet machine in the room, it did mean I could not take a short break before heading downtown. I asked at reception how long it will be to which I was told I could still use the room, and my response of 'well its hardly peaceful' was met with nothing more than an 'I know'. There was no acknowledgement of the inconvenience, or apology at the time. Through their customer service feedback to management I raised these issues, and to their credit, Kyle responded very quickly and acknowledged the shortfalls of my experience. This customer service does make me respect a place more, so thankyou, that has made me reconsider when to try Hyatt Place again. I am willing to give them another try, as I do believe I just had some bad luck with my experience, and it is not the standard.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Small quality hotel in NYC. Crazy TriBeCa incident. Receptionist Brandon was welcoming, personable, kind and informative. Together with colleague David - kept watchful eye on lobby and street day and night. Safety and comfort of guests were paramount. Complimentary Buffet breakfast was a bonus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place, 52 W 36th St, New York City, NY (Manhattan)We had some problems here but will be happy to stay again. The location is great. One block to subway. Walking distance to many iconic NYC buildings and locations that we are all familiar with from news, movies, etc. The problems: I found the front desk staff to be friendly but not proactive in solving problems. I had to get a supervisor in order to get a change in rooms as the first room choice was totally inappropriate. Later I had to ask for towels that were not replaced. The front desk agreed to take care of it and did not. It took me a couple of tries to get the people that serviced our room to give us extra pillows and to replace the worn out pillows. They should be authorized to make those changes on the fly as they see the wear and tear every day.The biggest challenge is the two elevators. Normally they are fine. During busy hours, particularly the last hour before breakfast ends, they are terrible. One day I had to go down from the 11th floor to the first floor by stair. My wife figured out that, rather than waiting 15-20 minutes and seeing full elevator after full elevator, she hit both the up and down button, caught an elevator going up which then guaranteed her that she would have an elevator to go down in. I cannot recommend that wheelchair or mobility challenged individuals have to deal with this. However, we now understand the issue and can work around it. Hotel might look at the elevator “call for service” algorithms. Seemed unpredictable.Room – 1107Internet – free, very good wi-fi, does not require user name or password.Television – LG, guessing maybe 36 inch. At foot of bed on top of a 3 drawer dresser in which the right side has a cut-out for mini-fridgeDVD player – noAir conditioning – yes. Works well. Easy to adjust.Electrical outlets – sufficient.Robes – no. Coffee Maker – yes, single cup, coffee filter pack, Arabica blend, brand unknown, Twinnings tea bagsMini-fridge – SummitMicrowave - noSmoking – NoAlarm clock – yesSafe for valuables – yes in closet.Hair dryer – yesIroning board and iron – yesGuest laundry - noCloset – very small closet with door. Sufficient number of hangars.Lighting – sufficientBathroom – typical bathroom with shower/bath tub.Towels, linens – excellentTissues (kleenex or equal) - YesFacecloths - yesBathroom amenities – Kenet MD, usual minimum soaps and shampooAmenity kit – noWeight scale – noUmbrella - noBed areaBed – King size, very comfortablePillow – some of their pillows were worn out; it took several tries to get them changed out.Bedside nightstands – wall mounted; minimal room on top.There is a small desk adjacent to closet and couch. Sufficient.Pool / Exercise room – No pool; exercise room on LL (lower level). Did not check it out.Breakfast – Yes. Reliable; reasonable offerings; very busy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed here many times over that last 10 years and enjoy the helpful and friendly staff and location of the hotel. The one change that I have noticed is that their breakfast has dramatically deteriorated. Plus if you want to stay in a room with two people with two beds, they charge also double of the rate for two people in one king bed. I have never seen this in any other hotels in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is very convenient for a visit to Manhattan and/or Midtown. Staff is very friendly and warm, very clean hotel and I would come back to this hotel again. The only problem I had was a request to extend my checkout a bit longer (only 2 hrs) but I was allowed only one hour, although most hotels with the same star rating would grant this complimentary service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a good hotel to stay in midtown manhattan, within a short walk from the 5th Ave. Positives include good breakfast options, timely house keeping service, friendly gallery hosts and decent size rooms with ironing, sofa, comfy beds. Slightly on the down side are the TV channel options - they're boring and you don't know which program is showing since the info isnt available in TV (even though there's an info button on remote). No music channels :( And the other let down was the elevators - just two for a 20+ floor hotel...and they make you wait for ages! So, summing it up, keeping aside the minor negatives, this is a good place for tourists and business people alike! Hope this helps.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Definitely recommend this hotel, This Hotel was very clean, reception staff very helpful, we had a family room which catered for 5 people, coffee and tea machine with a fridge, ironing board, hear drier, and safe, our room was on the 12th floor and you could see the Empire state building,Breakfast was ok, as much hot and cold food with drinks you could want, Breakfast can get busy after 8am and so can the lifts, so best get there as early as possible, we ordered a cab from the airport to the hotel through expedia, but on our way home we got the subway which was also very easy ( even with the 5 of us )

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Check in and check out were great. One thing I was really impressed with was that the two nights we stayed were paid for in Hyatt points. I expected to be getting the crappiest room in the place bc we didn't pay cash for this stay. I am really happy that your people understand that in order to get those points, we stayed many other times at a Hyatt and also use our Hyatt Credit card for almost everything. We were given a great room on the top floor, amazing view and very quiet (which was wonderful bc I had come down with an awful cold and wasn't sleeping well to begin with). The hotel itself was really nice! We normally stay at the Grand Hyatt by Grand Central Station, but honestly we don't use most of the amenities bc we are out all day and night with business and social engagements when we are visiting NYC. Hyatt Place was also closer to the subway lines we use most via Herald Square. The Hyatt Place obviously is a different type of hotel from The Grand Hyatt, but was a great hotel, and perfect for our needs. We will definitely consider it again in the future. We are rarely brand loyal for things these days, but we are generally Hyatt loyal bc we just don't have time to read 1000 reviews on Tripadvisor. We are normally on a deadline with chaotic travel needs, and just want to book something quickly and know it's going to be good. We have never been disappointed with any Hyatt stay. We are not particularly demanding guests, but even if something was amiss once in awhile, it has always been quickly addressed if possible. I don't usually write reviews bc time is just non-existent, but the staff was wonderful and we were really happy with how we were treated. I have worked in restaurant and hospitality, and I know that it is NOT easy work keeping people happy (especially with so much competition in NYC).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location: blocks away for the theaters and time square. The staff was very friendly and great complimentary breakfast. The rooms were nice/clean. Make sure you go up to the 26th floor terrace great views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: What a great stay we had!First I wrote an email to the hotel, we were in New York for the first time together, and it would be an aniversary stay. I requested a view room. Also mentioning that I knew that requests couldn’t always be honoured. William H. replied promptly, and said he would do his best. And boy did he. Once we arrived, we should ask for him, we did, and he rolled out the red carpet. Gave us a top floor room, although not a view of the Empire State, as there is a rooftop terrace on that side on the top floor. Our view was of the rest of New York! Jaw dropping! As at that side, that floor its more or less unobstructed.Whilst catching our breath, a knock at the door; a basket with snacks and drinks and (small) bottles of wine arrive, with the compliments of William. Like he didn’t do enough. All in all, a very comfortable stay, and impressive service. Room large for NYC standards. And to top it off, this stay was on points. Now that tells me Hyatt values their guests, on cash, OR on points! William made our weekend, and although I’m not sure if he is still at this particular hotel now (we stayed beginning of December 2016), I’m sure he’s making people smile wherever he is.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Have always had a consistent and great experience at the Hyatt Place - it's a great price and you get wonderful service from the team. All hotels have their challenges and this team really does their best to make the experience the best as possible. Pack your patience as the elevators can be slow during peak rush hour times. Plan ahead if you are on a tight schedule.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very well maintained property with a great staff! Subway and bus stops within a couple blocks that will allow to go anywhere in Manhattan. Rooms are not the typical Hyatt Place layout with the separate sitting area. But there is a couch and automan, so very comfortable sitting. Extremely comfortable bed and great room darkening shade. Also has a very nice observation deck on the 26th floor that overlooks the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at Hyatt Place New York for business it was a good stay the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful they even offered me a drink and snack after a long flight. The hotel in a perfect location everything you need is in walking distance. The breakfast buffet was outstanding and the rooms are clean had a nice view of a nice outside mall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First time to New York City with my family and Hyatt Place Midtown South was a convenient location for walking, subway and taxi access. The complimentary breakfast is perfect if your traveling with a big group, cuts the cost of an additional meal out. As soon as we arrived, we asked to drop our luggage off (assuming our room wasn't ready at 9 a.m.), but to our surprise, they let us in our room. The check in/out was easy and staff were friendly. Overall stay was positive for my first time in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Always good with Hyatt. Been all over and seek them out. Any issues are quickly resolved being member has perks that seem to payoff each time. Room was clean and updated. Staff was friendly even did Manhatten

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here after a cruiseNice relaxed atmosphere Staff very helpful Great location for sightseeing room was spotless and very spacious Tea and coffee providedBreakfast free which was great Would definitely return to this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here with some family for 4 nights in August and it was incredible. When I travel I try not to use the hotel rooms for much more than sleeping and showering, because I would rather spend my time seeing the city and exploring, and this is perfect for that.It is not an extremely fancy hotel, I would not recommend it for people who want extreme luxury but it is affordable, has great staff and the location is unbeatable. Also the free breakfast was a lifesaver!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good sized room on second floor at front of hotel. Large bathroom with modern suite. Room was quite noisy at night with traffic and bin men making a lot of noise at 2am in the morning both nights. A higher room would probably be quieter. Complimentary breakfast in room which got fairly crowded at busy times. Bedroom has large full length window which looked onto office block across street. Unfortunately there was no net curtain on window so there was no privacy. If you wanted to change etc you had to close the large roller blind which was very heavy to use due to its size. Enjoyed our stay main draw back was the window problem which they could resolve with minimum effort. Very convenient location

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here for a week and was pleased with my stay. The staff was great and friendly. Room was clean, modern and ok size for Manhattan. Breakfast was pretty good, although very crowded if you go anytime after 8. Good location close to Subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed 4 nights must say it’s was a great location 5 mins from Macy’s, 5th ave, and Empire State Building if you go upto the 26th floor of the hotel you get a fantastic view of the Empire State Building the picture I have posted was from the hotel Breakfast good, room clean, enjoyable stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Visited as business trip. My stay was overall great stay. Unfortunately I did not take the breakfast included but room rate, however, check in, check out and cleanliness was A1.Rate may be expensive for a Hyatt Place but is average Among other hotels in NY (Manhattan) area. Just a couple of blocks from the Empire State and one block from 5th Av, just a few streets from Times Square and subway. If I need to return to NY Mid Town, this hotel will be my first option.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel. Clean rooms, surprisingly nice breakfast assortment with Starbucks coffee and tea. Would recommend and would stay again. Staff was very quick and efficient with checking in and checking out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This Hyatt Place is not as big as others in other cities but it was a fantastic location and the staff is awesome! This hotel is in the heart of everything! They have a great breakfast and my room was so quiet and clean. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here with my husband a our two friends for 4 nights at the beginning of October and it was exactly what we had hoped for. The ladies on reception were a pleasure and the rooms were the biggest we've stayed in in New York. The breakfast is basic but it did the job! Location was great also. Cant complain! Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice hotel and location. Free breakfast was excellent ! My only complaint is the noise in the room at night from facing 36th St. My Mother and sister had rooms in the back and they didnt have the noise, otherwise I highly recommend this hotel !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Look, I have not been to New York for many years so was a little taken aback by the sore of the room. Ours had a king bed had a sofa but as a result little space for suitcases and a very small closet space so I have to conclude that it was better suited to short stay business travel. However if its simply a place to sleep, then you should be okay.The hotel itself is well located right next to the Empire State Building which puts it about 15 minutes walk to Times Square and Broadway and 25 minutes to Central Park. Around the corner is the Herald Square Subway and one block further the Penn Subway Station so using the transit system is big plus.The check-in was rush hour so it was bit chaotic with the two clerks doing double duty in managing the bar and snacks as well as fielding phone calls. However they tried the best and was efficient in the off-peak hours. The hotel is clean and the rooms well kept.Breakfast was included and the buffet contained the basics which did not vary over the week but very congested after 8:15am due to the 9:00 am shut down; as vacationers one would expected a longer opening hours. Rooms on the higher levels were noise free but did not offer much of a view as there were many other taller buildings in the area. Not having a service elevator meant that the staff were using the guest elevators which could be a bit annoying.All in all not a bad experience but a bit pricey, but then again its Manhattan and everything is more expensive!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good size and cleanliness.Location is great, and very convenient.Probably and isolated incident, but could improve on service and process.Early pre-check in was not helpful, we per-check in at 8am, but when we returned to get room at night, we were given room keys to someone else's room, just some extra trouble to clear it up.Breakfast is good, not as crowded as other reviews have mentioned.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The only strong point for this hotel is its location if you want to stay in the upper part of Midtown Manhattan. Otherwise, look for another place: room are small, noisy, dark with no view if you're given a room on the street side and lower floor as I was. Interesting enough, the staff told me they couldn't change my room because I did registered online. Although I reserved asking for a high floor, the automated check in gave me the worst possible room i.e 3rd floor (out of 25), and just above the entrance on the noisy street side. Therefore, never use the advance check in sent by e-mail! I was told I should have contacted the hotel staff directly after reservation asking for a high floor and a quiet room. Good to remember. About the included breakfast, you'd be better off in getting a decent one outside: the breakfast room is too small for so many people and it's almost impossible to move to get to the buffet where the food is poor, cold and always the same day after day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place midtown south NYC. The room is a nice size, immaculate with a beautiful view of the Empire State building. The people at the front desk are extremely pleasant and helpful. And the bonus is free breakfast. Fairly priced and reasonable. I recommend staying there, recommend staying there you won't be disappointed!
user_name:
Jeanne R
Massapequa Park, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is nice but nothing special. The cost of the rooms are not worth what you get especially if you are a hyatt member. I would suggest forgetting about getting hyatt points and going to a better hotel somewhere for the same price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located near subway and in walking distance from Empire State Building. Very clean premises and room. However, breakfast was very poor! Do not pay extra for breakfast. There are many other options within walking distance for a better breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Whats not to like, well the price of course but its New York and it's an average price.The hotel is in a great location for many of the places you'll want to visit and all within easy walking distance.The staff are friendly and helpful, booking in was very efficient. The rooms are compact, but that's usual in big cities London etc. They have everything you require. Comfy bed. Good shower and it's clean and tidy. Breakfast was very good with an excellent choice and more than enough to keep us going to the evening.I would definitely recommend this hotel.Dave

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have to start by saying that hotel staff is amazing (Jonathan in particular) and that makes everything better.The room was okay, clean and in decent shape. I had problems with the shade, it just didn't work. Luckily my view was a quiet street and the Empire State in the back.Price was okay, considering area standards. I was traveling with two kids and most hotels do not accept them these days. So that was a plus from this property.Location is key, as usual. Two blocks from the Empire State Building, 6 or 7 blocks from Grand Central, etcetera.I will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In for a couple of nights for a quick conference and the room was very nice and the staff very helpful and friendly. Location was good for our purpose. Rate the value as average because while the quality was good, because of the UN being in town, prices were jacked up and therefore the value for the price paid suffers.
user_name:
Ty C
Cleveland, TN, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Went to NYC for my birthday week & stayed here during my trip. Location is excellent & is just 10 min walk from Times Square & 5 mins from the subway. There is also plenty of stores & restaurants close by. Keens steakhouse is just 100 feet away. The staff is great most especially Andrea. Our flight came in early in the morning so she offered to hold our luggage while we ventured out for some lunch. Came back at noon & a room was ready. She also answered the phone every time I called & was very polite & answered all my questions prior to our arrival. Thanks Andrea for the excellent service! I will definitely be back at Hyatt Place Midtown in NYC on my next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed three nights and enjoyed the he hotel. Staff were all very friendly. Location is great - close to Empire State building and plenty of bars and restaurants, but not on a super busy street. The room was pretty spacious, in good repair, had lots of power outlets, and good towels and toiletries. Housekeeping did an excellent job. The hotel has free breakfast which I didn't try, a little shop where you could get a beverage or snack, and a cool program where you can borrow things like phone chargers if you forget yours. My only complaint was it was slow to get an elevator in the morning, and it was always jammed by the time it got to the 5th floor. Eventually I started just used ng the stairs. All in all a good visit, and I would be happy to stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this property three nights in September. The other reviewers hit on all the pros and cons so I have nothing new to add. Overall, a very pleasant stay in a reasonably priced, clean, and friendly hotel. P.S. Make sure to check out the patio on the top floor for a nice view of the Empire State Building; and eat some authentic Korean food nearby in “Korea Town.”

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great Breakfast!! Comfortable and clean room. Try to get a high floor, very noisy with garbage trucks at 4:30am, take Advil PM if on a lower floor. Staff very helpful and willing to make you comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: room was adequate, clean and no complaints. we were on the second floor which was great we thought there would be too much noise but really not an issue and it was nice to not have to deal with elevators and just hit the stairs. Breakfast being included was great for our kids, even if it wasn't really what my wife and I wanted.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Rooms are large and well laid out--they're very comfortable for work travel and would be great for an extended stay. Easy and effective internet access, really nice staff, Hyatt loyalty and good location make this an easy pick.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Sorry - this is absolutely the very worst Hyatt I've ever stayed in. Even walking up to it I was very surprised that this was part of the hyatt brand. We stayed in room 1706 and it was small and very basic and very LOUD. Of the three towels, two had HOLES in them. During our one night stay, the loud children running around pulled the fire alarm, and the trucks going by in the middle of the night and drivers honking horns did not make for a quiet stay. The staff was very pleasant but couldn't make up for the sub standard facility. One shampoo and conditioner but no shower gel or lotion or any other type of amenities in the room. Very disappointed for a close to $650 room for one night. Much nicer hotels in better areas for a lot less than this one.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Decided to do something different for my 43rd birthday. I wanted to spend the weekend as a NYC Tourist & this Hotel was PERFECT!! Right in the heart of midtown with everything in a few minutes distances. Rooms are small but clean, modern & quiet! Room service food AWESOME & delicious fresh food at 2am; priceless! Gym & breakfast was included; added bonus! Will be returning GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here 5 days. The location is absolutely perfect. Close to Penn station/MSG, subway, Times square, Broadway and the Empire State building. We arrived at 2pm and was told our room wasn't ready, but they got us a different one - and it had a unobstructed view of the Empire State building (room 2402). Thank you staff for that! It really made a great impression on my kids first time trip to NYC. Room was small, but expected for Manhattan. For our family, we'd rather stay small and be in the mix than travel from outside to downtown. It's only a few days and we travel light. Rooftop area has a lot of potential, but seems to be pretty much ignored. If I could suggest one thing, it's make that area a destination rather than forgotten. We went up there nearly evening for a nightcap and it was deserted. Breakfast was good and had something different every day. As others have mentioned, get there before 7:30am to avoid lines. Who wants to sleep in when your visiting NYC anyway?

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Found this Hyatt Place to be very good. The rooms could be larger, but were quite comfortable for my family of 5. Everything worked as it should and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was not too bad. The only thing I would like to see changed is that they could use real eggs.I would definitely stay at this Hyatt Place again as the location was also great and within 20 minutes walk to anywhere worth seeing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Place New York for a period of one week in a queen-sized bedroom. Having booked the room for five people on Hyatt website, we were surprised to discover at our arrival that the bedroom was equipped for only four people. As a matter of fact, the bathroom was only having four apparent towels, one soap and a sofa-bed with no sheets. We therefore indicated to the reception desk that we desired more supplies for our stay.For each consecutive day, we had to remind the reception staff that we were missing supplies, as the cleaning staff removed the additional supplies each day, leaving supplies for only four people. Also, on the first days of our trip to NYC, the cleaning staff mistakenly removed the teddy bear of one of us. Unable to retrieve it, the reception staff offered us a free night but the harm was done. We tried to contact them a week ago through Facebook to have a last update about the teddy bear. We got no answer.Hyatt Place nonetheless offered a good price-quality deal, combining comfort with an excellent bedding quality, calm rooms, and a large buffet for breakfasts. We however could not dissociate our review of this hotel from a feeling of not having been listened to, as the staff repeated the same mistakes until our last day in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed there for two nights. Easy friendly check in. Rooms typically of Hyatt place, clean nice but pretty simple and maybe a little smaller.Breakfast was good but one morning it was packed and no space to sit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A short walk to everything. Rooftop terrace with view of Empire State Building was phenomenal! Breakfast was perfect and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for 5 days in this great hotel. Bedroom had sofabed & was just about adequate when bed set up for 2 adults & 2 teenage children. When folded plenty of space & the room had all the amenities we needed. Staff very friendly & the locations is the best bit. Just round the corner from Macy's & Empire State Building & within easy walking distance of lots of other sites. Breakfast was ok re food on offer. Frustrating part was a lack of tables when busy & other people where saving tables for the rest of the party to arrive. Suggest the hotel allocates tables on arrival to stop this practice. Other than that small issue we really enjoyed our stay here & would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel! Staff so friendly and helpful. Breakfast delicious with loads of choice. Perfect location. ESB view from our room. Large room with huge TV, fridge, lots of towels, air con. Couldn't ask for more really! 100% recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I almost exclusively stay at Hyatt whenever I travel. I usually enjoy my stay but this Hyatt property was a huge disappointment, and I will never stay at this property and will recommend my friends not to stay.- front desk staff upon check-in was anything but friendly (despite all the reviews that said otherwise)- while I have a status that gives me an enhanced view room upon check-in, I got a room that overlooked ugly rooftops of nearby building (with trashbags and what have you) which was a huge disappointment as I was treating my mother with a weekend trip to the city- the cleaning lady igorned our "come back later" sign we hung at the door and still let herself in to clean the room- there were only two elevators which were ridiculously slow- the breakfast was the WORST I've had compared to other Hyatt Place or Hyatt House properties

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great rates, centrally located without all the noise of Times Square, lots of great restaurants nearby. Most importantly, the staff was very friendly and so upbeat all the time! I will always stay at this hotel when going to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel offers free breakfast which is really good. The hotel is located near the largest Macy in the world. Awesome department stores and restaurants nearby. The Empire State Building is nearby also. I was there for a short time but have a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is near Time Square. Breakfast is more than just a continental breakfast. Eggs, potatoes, fruit, oatmeal, cereal, some kind of meat (bacon, sausage). Open from 6am -9am. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and beds comfy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location, cleanliness and price were amazing. The location was perfect for all the major attractions. Huge benefit also is the bars are very close to this area. Everyone at the hotel was nice and friendly. No issues! Would stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booked a short trip with my youngest son. The hotel was clean and the staff was super helpful. They made my stay pleasant went out of their way to accommodate us. The location is excellent just minutes away from Times Square, restaurants, shops and bars.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have stayed in Manhattan many times over many years. This was in the area we usually stay and a very nice surprise as this is a fairly new hotel in the area we like. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was a very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for five nights 13-18 Aug. Room ready on arrival. Great view of empire state building from our room. Rooms are more than adequate with a large TV and a massive and comfy bed. The free breakfast is great. Ideally positioned for shopping and shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had 3 people in one room and it never felt cramped. The couch was very comfortable. A no frills hotel but also very comfortable and accommodating. Can't beat the free breakfast. Would absolutely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt place New York. It is very close the Empire State Building and a short walk from Grand Central Station. The 26th floor has a view of the Empire State Building which is fantastic. They offer a great breakfast buffet each morning. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. I will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location near Herald Square. Close to subway station and central location for tourist attractions. Clean rooms, clean hotel, friendly staff. Would definitely recommend. We will return next time we visit NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have stayed at Hyatt Place about ten times. Midtown location is excellent and convenient to subway and walking distance to numerous NYC sites. Moderately priced hotel with pleasant helpful staff and a decent buffet style breakfast. Great value overall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I love this hotel and as I visit 4 times a year for business it is great to have a comfortable place in a perfect location with caring staff. Amenities are great; service is always top notch and room is always comfortable!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the hotel during the Memorial Holidays and it was just as great as expected. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. It was our first time in New York and the location was quite pleasing as we were close to great shopping areas as well as the Empire State building. New York is an awesome city and the location allowed us to easily explore whether on foot, rail or wheels. Our room gave us a spectacular view of the Empire State building which was beautifully lit each night of our stay.We sent packages to the resort and had no problem retrieving them upon arrival.Breakfast is including and provided a quite delectable energy boost for our daily explorations.The room was extremely clean and comfortable.We definitely would recommend this hotel, we have zero complaints! Once again it was a pleasure staying at a Hyatt Place hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I would recommend the Hyatt Place in Midtown NYC, compared to time square it was very peaceful and my daughter and I felt very safe walking around the city. Centrally located we found the location to be extremely useful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I had an awesome experience with the Hyatt Place in Scottsdale, AZ, and this one was just as great! Perfect location, room and service! Breakfast buffet was also outstanding! not one negative thing to say. And their customer service was also outstanding! I will definitely go back to the Hyatt Place when in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I understand hotel rooms in NY are not usually very big. At the Hyatt Place our room, in my opinion, was a good size. In addition to a large bed, we had a sofa. Not much of a view but we weren't in our room to look at the view. I loved the bathroom. We had a fridge, safe and kettle. Sometimes the lift was slow but when it was, we used the stairs. The breakfast is adequate. The breakfast area could be larger but we always managed to find a table so we were happy. I recommend getting down early to avoid the rush. Breakfast items were constantly being restocked. We needed to be near Penn station. Perfect location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location. Breakfast was great. We were on a family vacation of 6, and had a great expierence at this hotel. Highly recommend! We went to the rooftop for one of the night to have a few alcoholic beverages. Great view..only downside-no pool.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are looking for a midrange priced hotel in a perfect location, this is for you. The facility is nice, staff very friendly, and everything is just out the door or down the street. The view of the Empire State Building out my window is awesome.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: can't be better, nice food, great location, nice staff, nice view from the room, room is roomy and clean. great breakfast. close to everything. clean clean clean very nice can't be better. recommend to everyone. i love hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt place is so we'll located , right in the middle of action packed NYC.Very courteous staff always smiling and ready to answer your queries very comfortable place .neat and clean and serves good hot breakfast every morning.And right across the street is a very nice Mexican restobar, serving good cocktails beers and yummy food

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The people at the front desk were very gracious and sincere. They greeted us every time we returned from the busy streets. Our first night there was a mishap with our booking but they were able to accommodate us and then arrange our actual room the following night. Our second room had an amazing view of the Empire State building, one that is hard to find elsewhere. It was so beautiful. The breakfast was excellent, and I liked how they had varied food choices for different days. All of them were delicious and filling. A lot of diverse food and drink options. The dining area is rather large.  The Internet was pretty fast for us, and I liked how simple it was to connect (I've stayed at other places that would have many unnecessary steps in order to get online) The location was just what we wanted and we were able to get to where we wanted from here easily. Our room was clean and we were able to have a quiet rest every night. It was nice to be able to come back to a tidy and peaceful area after eventful days in the city. Would stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wonderful location, close to most popular attractions. Very helpful and nice staff. Best value for Manhattan. The free breakfast is a plus. The rooms are clean and updated. An excellent choice for a weekend getaway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed many times before but I was extremely disappointed this time as the toilet wasn't working, I couldn't get the room temperature to change and the hairdryer was terrible quality and took me over an hour just to dry MOST of my hair....I complained but they replaced it with the same rubbish

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Expectations entering a Hyatt Hotel are high and one could be disappointed entering this relatively small Hotel in NY, very close the the 5th Avenue and many other sights. Having a room to the backside of the building I did not need to listen to NY traffic all night long, because the City does not sleep. Instead I had a relaxing sleep in the relatively spacious room, which was the cleanest I experienced in NY. The breakfast was not outstanding, but offers everything you need including eggs, bacon cereals,a wide range of breads and morning rolls. Really worth the price although being not cheap. I'll come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall I'd give this Hyatt Property 4.5 stars. I stayed with my 19 year old daughter and her boyfriend who had never experienced Manhattan like we did this weekend. Dinner in little Italy Saturday night and walking about Times Square afterwards. Shopping in SoHo on Sunday and a great dinner at a local SoHo favorite recommended by a store clerk and it was amazing. Restaruant called "Parm" specializing in, you guessed, Chicken Parm and Eggplant Parm as well as meatballs which were sold out when we ordered. We shall return to both The Hyatt and Parm.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My stay at this hotel was fantastic. I had a high floor room with a view of the Empire State Building, that literally made me say "wow" when I walked in. The rooms are very large, especially for a New York hotel. There was plenty of space to walk around and for my luggage and even a couch to relax on that looked out the window. Everything was clean and the staff was very friendly. Will definitely look to stay at this hotel again for a trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If your looking to be treated well, by friendly, helpful people, then this is your place to stay! The staff was amazing, we were so pleased. The hotel was clean, and the location was great - right next to the Empire State building, and right down the street from Broadway, Macys, etc. Times Square not being too much further. Fantastic first experience in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location of this hotel is really great and some of the staff were quite kind. However, for being a Hyatt Place, you would expect much more than the rooms provide. I was quite disappointed. There are no master light switches near the bed so each night I had to fumble in the dark to get to my bed. There are no charging areas near the bed, so I had to charge my phone near the television. No bottles of water so I had to purchase my own. Room was also not cleaned after my first night. Biggest issue was that the lights were not turned on for breakfast. All the people were eating in the dark. The staff said the person who could turn the lights on would not arrive until 10am. Better to stay at the Holiday Inn next door.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We liked the location in the heart of downtown, and the breakfast. The room was a little pricy, and bright because we were across from office buildings. It was hard to sleep due to the bright lights. There was also a long wait for the elevator.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We brought an exchange student from Madrid who wanted to see NYC. This location was fantastic. We walked to shopping, Times Square, and Central Park. Parking was so convenient, hat several doors down. The staff was exceptional, cheerful, friendly, helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Family grad vacation for my daughter to see a Broadway musical. Very good location for Macy's, Empire State and a 10 minute walk to times square. Adequate breakfast but closed early, you are in NYC late nights generally doesn't lend to early mornings.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a great night in New York. Hotel was free due to Hyatt Gold passport Membership. The hotel was fine. The show was fantastic. Would recommend hotel and area it is close to good restaurants. Try this place

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Central location, horrendous traffic to and from. Nice room, helpful front desk staff. Poor breakfast in terms of quality and choices. Slow elevators during busy times. Ordered a car to go to the airport - that didn't happen, though not totally their fault (accident at street entrance). However - they did not make any effort to actually pick me up.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I travel for the first time to NY and this Hotel was perfect! It's location is great, near almost every attraction. Room was good for a party of 5. Front Desk employees are very friendly and helpful. Looking forward to stay there again. Breakfast was included with the price and it was a must.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I travel with my kids and a friend, we were five in the room, I was worried that it might be to tight but it was perfect, we had a very nice and comfortable stay. The location is great walking distance to many nice places.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are on vacation and want to leisurely go to breakfast, you'll have to eat elsewhere. Although the complimentary breakfast was supposed to last through 9:30, almost all food was put away by 9:05 - including all drinks. There were boxes of cereal, some fruit, bagels, and toast left at that time. Had to request drinks. Milk for cereal was warm.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here as a family of 5 in a room with a view. The room was ok sized for NYC. The view was great from the 23rd floor! The room was comfortable, clean, and overall pleasant. The location is FANTASTIC.The breakfast here was very rich and good - however, VERY crowded. Long lines and lots of irritation first thing in the morning. Also, the desk mistakenly told us that breakfast ends at 9:30 on a weekday when they actually close down at 9:00... so we were late and found ourselves scrambling for leftovers. Luckily, the staff there was VERY nice and brought us out some more things that were missing.Another problem with this hotel is the elevators... Lots of waiting, stopping on almost every floor during busier hours. Perhaps they should add a couple more elevators...And finally, as other reviewers have mentioned, the price is suited to the location - this won't work for a tight budget.Overall though, a great hotel located in a prime spot!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booking system messed up, they had us in three separate rooms for one night v 1 room for three nights. gave us handicapped room, and when we wanted a new room there was none available. Room was like dungeon, black out shade broke, Positive a/c and it was quiet.
user_name:
F4930HYdana
new york city, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place Midtown South will definitely be my hotel of choice whenever I visit NYC. As most have already stated, this hotel is perfectly located. You can walk to most week known places in the city or it's easy to take the subway, bus, taxi or Uber.The customer service was amazing. I wish that I could remember everyone's name but I do recall Manley, Rayna and Serene. But I stress that literally everyone we encountered went out of our way to provide 5 star customer service. Our room was very nice, clean and spacious for. NYC hotel. The rates are very reasonable as well. The breakfast was delicious every morning and it's complimentary which saved us additional money. Our room had a sweet view of the Empire State Building which is only a stone's throw away. There is a roof top patio on the 26th floor and I went out there each night playing music on my phone, singing and dancing when no one else was around lol.I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Couldnt really fault the place. Rooms were small but we fitted in 6 people. Breakfast had a good variety available. The lift may have been small, but we were only on the second floor. Reception folk were helpful. But really you are paying for the location which is very good. No noise which was a surprise. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I read reviews...I write reviews. I think they are very helpful. I also think that like everything else, it comes down to a matter of opinion and the way one person sees the world. If someone is having a hard time, and is further annoyed by something that otherwise isn't annoying = bad review... and the same on the other end of the scale. We stay in NYC at a minimum twice a year. We have done the airbnb thing, stayed with friends, etc. This is because most places are too expensive or are complete dumps. This place is so sweet. Is it fancy? nope, is it super modern? nope, were there tourists everywhere?, yep.... but hey, its in the middle of Manhattan, litterly a stones throw from the Empire State Building. Why someone would be surprised or annoyed by this place being "full of people" or "crowded" is beyond me. That same person must have despised NYC in general.  The staff (Maribel, Andrea, and Mabley in particular) were professional, attentive, informed and just cool overall. The terrace on the 26th floor is worth the already inexpensive price tag. We were very happy with our experience and will definitely stay here again and again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a typical Hyatt Place hotel - quality furnishings and linens, everything was clean and in good condition. The free breakfast was very good (but very crowded) and better than breakfast at Fairfield, Hampton, etc. The ONLY minor issue with this hotel is that the rooms are small (although possibly normal by NYC standards). The King room has a non-sleeper sofa with not much extra room. The rooms with 2 queen beds are larger but more expensive. The hotel elevators were also fairly slow. Despite these minor issues I was very happy with this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel location was nice, but i checked into a musty smelling room, then asked to get switched to another room that smelled the same. In the room for the first 3 hours sinuses acted up terribly. Room had some mildew or mold in it. Stayed for 4 days, whenever i was not in the room and once i checked out, i could breath fine. After second room change, was told to open the hotel window, did that but that did not help. Elevators were very slow in the AM. I travel a lot and have a high status with Marriott, decided to try another hotel chain to start gaining status with them, after this experience with the Hyatt, i will not be back. Even tho the staff didn't help me in the smelly room, maybe because all the rooms smell like it, but the staff was nice. Compared to other hotels in that area, hotel room was small.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was a bit disappointed after all the positive reviews. The place is quite average, with a small reception and tiny hall, always packed with tourists. Elevators are very slow, with lots of waiting. Everything is quite basic and dated, would definitely need some renovation, as it seems not clean at times. Rooms are spacious, some with nice views and large windows. However the furniture is old. There is very little closet space. Our fridge was too noisy, so we unplugged it at night. Noise from the outside, doesn't allow good sleep, without interruptions. Breakfast is a plus,with a good variety, without being exceptional. The Hotel is on a street that doesn't look clean and has a tiny sidewalk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Close to major attractions, Time Square,Rockefeller, Broadway,Empire State building, just to name a few. Was clean and easy for tourists to get around!Staff were very helpful, and prompt in responding to requests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
