review_body: I have stayed three nights with my young son for a short trip from DC. I can say that I have made the perfect choice. The hotel staff at the front were welcoming and also helpful to everyone giving directions to various places. There was a subway station close to the hotel which takes you to major places, and a safe & short walk to the Empire State Building where we went at night to see the beautiful skyscrapers. The room we first had did not have the exact view we wanted, but they kindly offered to switch the next day as a room was available. Both rooms were very quiet. My son also made friends of his age who was visiting from another country. It was a great experience. The hotel is very clean&modern but unlike the big hotels I never had to wait in long line to talk to the front desk. I was running out of time to catch my bus to DC and the lady at the front desk rushed to get our suitcase from storage, so that we could leave right away. I recommend this hotel to families who are wishing to have a memorable trip to NY!
user_name:
Miwaada
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I love this hotel.it's super comfy.Loved our room,very spacious for NYC and clean.what I like even better was the location in the middle,very convenient if you want to go uptown or downtown. The lobby and staff were great.I'd stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is within a short walk of Macy's/Herald Square/Madison Square Garden and 34th Street/Penn Station. My room on level 22 looked straight out to the Empire State Building which lit up at night enticed me to leave the blinds up all night. The room rate was modest for Manhattan and included a complimentary breakfast. The room was not large but had a king size bed, a TV unit and a sofa along the full size window. The bathroom was small but serviceable with a shower, sink and toilet. Complimentary shampoo, conditioner and soap provided. Ironing board, safe and mini bar fridge were all appreciated. The room and bathroom was very clean although the towels were not as plush as you'd expect from a Hyatt. The coffee maker and the Twinnings English breakfast teabags were appreciated. There is no room service but you can order from a limited menu and pick it up from the lobby. However within less than 200m there are a range of pubs, cafes and even a McDonalds. I ordered a town car from reception to JFK which was $68 a lot cheaper than from more expensive uptown hotels. I organised a late check out and they offered to store my luggage too. The service was very good and friendly. It was great for a night or two in the city, a quick shop at Macy's and access to the subway station which has ACE, NQR, DFMand the PATH lines and regional trains from Penn Station. Only two elevators so can be a bit slow.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We recently had a great stay at the Hyatt Place - Midtown. We were referred by a friend and it was a great referral. Very convenient location. Clean and spacious room. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We had shopped the price and it was very competitive with other hotels. We had a great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Although this location wasn't my top choice I am glad I choose to stay here. The location is actually not far at all from top attractions and transportation. I called to let them know I would be a late check in but they said it's no problem. When I arrived the manager was there and remembered my calling. He said my type of room wasn't available so he changed to two rooms with larger accommodations. He did not charge me any extra either. What a pleasant surprise - my son was thrilled to stay in a room next to us. The next day I wasn't feeling well and the desk attendant offered me water and asked me to let her know if she could get me anything or give advise on where to get over the counter meds nearby. Then I called the desk close to midnight for an extra blanket and they asked if I needed anything else and were speedy with delivering it to our room. I've stayed in higher star-rated hotels and not received this good of customer service. If you are staying in Manhattan area please consider this hotel. Also great rooms, clean and spacious. The shower was enormous. Very comfy bed and pillows. A little noise from the street but that's to be expected in this big city. Pretty mellow outside the hotel at night though. I definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed in many hotels and this was perfect for dropping your bags, running out on the town, having a place to sleep. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Not spacious but I wasn't intending to spend any length of time at the hotel. Small boutique feeling. Certainly would stay here again. Close to Macy's/Herald Square/Empire State Building. Free breakfast. Good for families too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Lower floors too noisy at night. Staff seemed very preoccupied on final day checkout. One person was very good with us upon check out a young man was very courteous sand friendly. We also needed to obtain gluten free choices but were limited on the room menu.
user_name:
Viktoria P
Cape Coral, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For a friendly, clean and modern short stay this is the Place. Modern rooms, free wifi, large screen tv. Close to local transport and all the facilities of midtown NY. Lots of restaurants close by and easy to get to everytwhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was large, clean and quiet on the 15th floor overlooking the Empire State Building. The only problem was it was accessible without a shower berm and the water would flow out onto the bathroom floor. It took creativity and many towels to keep it in, but we managed. The bed was a little firm for my liking, but my friends slept fine. The breakfast was typical and the room was crowded, but again, we managed fine and it was nice to save money not having to go out every morning. When the elevator was slow, I just walked the 15 floors. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Midtown for one night, on business. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly. Some street noise despite being on the 5th floor, but can't help that in New York. Great Midtown location, convenient to everything I needed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location, great service, great size rooms especially for NYC.Great staff......have stayed there on more than one occasion and the staff and service have been consistently good.Friendly environment for guests who appeared to be there for different reasons - family get togethers, business trips and individual travellers.For a comfortable stay in in central (midtown) Manhattan, you don't need to look much further than the Hyatt Place Midtown South.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: All of the reviews about this hotel are on point. From the moment I checked in, to when I checked out, the staff and hotel itself were superb. When I checked in, the gentleman was gracious and helpful. The room was on the 32nd floor and was quite (for NYC) and very clean. I will stay here every time I come to NYC, even if it isn't very convenient for me.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was really big and had a really good view, on the 21st floor. The beds were also big and the beedroom had all that was necessary. The gym was ok for running. The location of the hotel was really good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel exceeded our expectations. It is conveniently located near Herald Square and Macy's. Small rooms but very clean, very comfortable, and very quiet. Up to date decor with all the amenities. There's many places to eat within a short walking distance. There's a small cafe next door called Pure and Fresh that makes breakfast to order and serves lunch and dinner also. Very good and very reasonable. We plan to stay at this hotel at our next year NYC visit!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Pace Mid town this past week.. the room was very comfortable - super comfy mattress and spacious bathroom. nice amenities - like their breakfast selection. friendly staff - always available . overall a good value and great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved my stay at this Hotel. It was locally centered in Mid-Town. The free breakfast was great. Options changed daily. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone on business. For the overall value this Hotel offers I will be staying again for my next trip. Many food options in very close walking distance. Sleeping street side was a little noisy but still a great stay.
user_name:
Erin-Leigh H
Salt Lake City, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for four nights while we toured Manhattan. The hotel met the high standards that Hyatt sets for its properties. The staff was efficient and helpful. (Hi Tammy). The breakfast service was excellent. We needed to drive to Manhattan (not recommended) and the parking arrangements with a next door garage were a bargain. We will definitely stay here again on return trips to the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location, easy walk from Penn Station and centrally located to all the sites. Clean and comfy rooms. Accommodating and friendly staff. Free breakfast is always a plus! Would definitely stay here again. Thanks, Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: When we checked in with five people our room was over booked. They gave us two very nice rooms right next to each other. Then the next day we got upgraded to a top floor room for the rest of our stay. The room had Serta mattresses and very so wonderful. The breakfasts were average. They did have problems with keeping Plates. Bowls and Cups in supply. The Fitness Center was small and average equipment, but they provided all the extras, head phones, towels and cold water.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just return from new York staying at the Hyatt place hotel 7/3/2016, stayed there for 8 nights ,and found the staff were very friendly and helpful .the room we stayed in was very clean and had everything you needed, the views were outstanding of the empire state building from are bedroom window ,my wife and I could not fault the hotel . Location of the hotel was perfect as it was only five minutes walk from times square and very close to all the other main areas To round it off the hotel and location made are holiday and would stay there at any time .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Check-in and elevators were super quick. Staff greeted us with bottled water and appeared at our door with complimentary fruit and wine to celebrate our "girls' weekend". Hot breakfast was very good with lots of variety & healthy options. Location is excellent - 5 minute walk to Times Square, one block from Fifth Avenue shopping, and plenty of restaurants nearby. We had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building from our room. Outstanding value. I would highly recommend Hyatt Place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a room at the 19th floor with a nice view on the Empire State Building. The staff was nice and the hotel location is at walking distance to many attractions. The subway is not not far from the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My first choice was Hyatt Times Square, because I stayed there last year. They were booked so I researched for kindred properties. I was favored to find this hotel. I loved the convenience of Check-in . I called ahead to inquire of options because I would arrive before the standard check-in time. I spoke with Kamesha, over the phone and she was immensely helpful and assured me that I wouldn't have to wait in the cold till my room was ready! Lol! My words, but basically what happened. Thank you for being so incredibly accommodating. Upon arrival I was greeting by an optimistic and enthusiastic Dulce, she is very welcoming. I also received excellent Guest Service from Tamon and Charmine. They make a great Front Desk Team. I was also impressed by the cleanliness of the property. The breakfast is pretty good, and its complementary. Location is Key here, made my trip to UN an easy drive. Thanks for making our trip to New York a MEMORABLE ONE! Will come again, MS Davis
user_name:
Latoya D
West Palm Beach, Florida

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean. The rooms were small and the area was loud but we expected this and it did not effect our stay. We loved being in the area. Easy access to everything in the city.
user_name:
Robert M
NY city, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The customer service at the front desk was excellent at check in time. We were able to get checkout extended by 1 hour to accommodate our flight departure time. The room was comfortable, modern, clean, with a fabulous view of the Empire State Building from the window in the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just off Times Square. Perfect for Broadway show. Room fit our family of 4 and we had an incredible view of the Empire State Building. Hotel staff was awesome and really looked after us. Room was quiet and clean. Easy walk to everything. We'll stay here again.
user_name:
Charles C
Riva, MD, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I booked this hotel directly on their website, got a phenomenal nightly rate for three nights (Thurs-Sat each $127) 2 queen beds with couch/bed (2 adults, 14 & 11 year old) including hot skillet buffet style breakfast (eggs & open egg sandwiches selections changed daily, all yummy!) I called a few days before we were leaving to see if the room was available to add on Wednesday night- not only was it available but the nightly rate was reduced to $109...for ALL FOUR NIGHTS! This Hyatt was very clean (which is a main criteria for my OCD cleaning self), all staff we encountered were friendly & accommodating. Only twice did i need help from the staff...the main lobby bathroom had run out of toilet paper one morning- I informed the front desk & within moments a guy arrived to fill it up & even cleaned up a bit. The 2nd time we called from our room when we noticed there wasn't a remote for the TV...idk how this man arrived so quickly with a replacement! I asked for a room our kids would like- we were given a room on the 20th floor with an awesome view of the Empire State building! My kids & I would lay on the bed at night just staring out the window at the lights of the ESB & surrounding night skyline talking about our day. This Hyatt is so centrally located to everywhere we wanted to go. (I thought I'd have to spend extra money taking subways all over but we walked everywhere- except to Battery Park- 9/11 memorials, Freedom Tower area-the kids wanted to take the subway back & forth to this area then we walked around to each site :) We easily walked to Empire State Building, Times Square, Broadway (saw Finding Neverland), Bryant Park, Grand Central Terminal, Chrysler building,... Chelsea Market was the furthest,about 20 mins.) Back at the Hyatt...each morning after breakfast (before we got into the events planned for the day) the kids would go on the computers in the lobby area while I sat there reading the free daily news papers & striking up conversations with fellow travelers from around the globe about current events. Great overall experience staying at Hyatt Place...totally would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for the weekend and the location couldn't have been better! Staff was amazing, it was very quiet and room was clean. I found it to be cramped, no microwave and fridge barely got anything cold. View was amazing and I would probably stay here again if the fridge worked and the room had a microwave as advertised.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Easy check-in by very competent, friendly staff. Rooms are clean and quiet with good mattresses and linens. Coffee pot in the room w/Starbucks coffee. Big Window with view of brick walls. Bathroom is updated with walk-in shower, new towels and good toiletries. Can't comment on the free breakfast but urns of Starbucks coffee available in the dining area free to guests. Wi-Fi was spotty. It was a very easy walk from Penn station with luggage. Easy, quick walk to numerous subway lines that connected us everywhere in Manhattan &Brooklyn. I would recommend; I would go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The service at this hotel is exceptional! Very nice rooms, plenty of outlets, charging station, mini fridge, great linens and amenities, and a full breakfast. Great location, walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Bldg, and many other attractions. But the best thing about this hotel is the staff and their friendly, helpful, accommodating service. I traveled with a party of 11 women and we had a wonderful time at this lovely hotel, I highly recommend it to anyone travelling to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: To say I was surprised would be an understatement! Maybe I'm being stereotypical here, but when you think of New York City hotels that are close to everything, you typically think of PRICEY, DIRTY, AND LOUD! I couldn't have been more mistaken! Hyatt Place NY Midtown South is in the perfect location. Everything is within walking distance! My fiancé and I went to a Broadway show that was just 7 blocks away at Times Square. There was a Dunkin Donuts and a Starbucks at the end of the block the hotel is on. We enjoyed a delicious dinner at a beautiful restaurant the next street over. Everything is right within your reach!Now for the cleanliness- surpassed everything I expected! We arrived at our room and it smelled fresh and clean, the bathroom was spotless, and there was not a thing out of place. Kudos to the housekeeping staff because they obviously pay very close attention to detail and it shows. The volume- As I had mentioned, we were just a few blocks away from Times Square, in the middle of New York City...and we barely heard any noise from our street-facing room on the 9th floor. Coming from a household that is always loud and dirty, I didn't want to leave this clean, quiet hotel. The only reason I did not rate 5 stars is because we were told that breakfast would be served until 11am. We got there at 10, and they were already putting things away, so there wasn't much of a spread.But of course, that shouldn't stop you from staying here. Beautiful hotel, wonderful views, walkable routes, and very kind and courteous staff all around. You would be a fool not to stay here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was super clean and run by an exceptional front desk staff. Check-in process was very quick and they checked my bags until my room was ready. Room was very clean and spacious. Breakfast had a wide variety of choices beyond typical continental breakfasts offered at many hotels. Concierge service was key in getting a reservation for 7 people on Valentine's day. Parking was $39+/day which for downtown Manhattan is AWESOME!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for two nights. Room was nice, clean and modern. Mattress and couch both very comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was surprisingly good, with starbucks coffee, some hot entrees as well a the usual fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc. Wish the breakfast room was a big larger as it was crowded as the hotel seemed pretty full. Had to wait for a seat, and clear the table yourself as some people didn't realize that they were supposed to clear their own table. Walk to Times Square, Broadway, Eataly, MOMA and Central Park. Very nice front desk people.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem!!The hotel is close to so much, yet seems slightly secluded! Breakfast in the morning is decent (although not as veggie friendly as one would have liked), and the decor is up to par with what one would expect for this grade of hotel.The front desk staff are friendly and efficient - and they make you feel welcome.I would definitely come back to to this hotel!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Came with 10 girlfriends for my 50th birthday. Chose Hyatt Place for location, size of rooms, and breakfast option. Was so impressed we shared our opinion of the hotel all over Manhattan during our 6 night stay. Would recommend to anyone! They catered to our every need and want, food and service was phenomenal! Their patience with 11 middle aged partying women should be commended! Thank you, Hyatt Place! Hope to see you again someday! Oh, and the view of the Empire State Bldg from my bed exceeded my dreams!
user_name:
Deborah G
Seattle, Washington, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am really happy to stay second time in 4 months and the experience has been excellent. The front Desk team are friendly and helpful and it was a great feeling. The location is wonderful. one can walk around the shopping district in 5th, 6th and seventh Avenue in about 10 minutes. i recommend to couple, families and single traveler to try it out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have been utilizing this hotel for most stays in Manhattan for several years. We never fail to receive anything but the best of services and facilities. The location is absolutely perfect for both business and pleasure (theater, opera, museums) and transportation arrival and departure (Penn Station/Amtrak). Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed 8 nights. Very clean and well serviced with Breakfast included. Close proximity to Macy's, H&M, JC Perry and more as just around the corner on 6th Ave. Times Square less than a 10 minute walk. Empire State around the corner. Train Subway at end of street. Good Pub Restaurants near by. All round a good hotel at a very reasonable price for location. Highly recommend.
user_name:
Darren & Sally S
New York City, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed one night here...very convenient to Times square, Broadway, Macy's etc...Lobby wasn't much but the rooms were pretty good and breakfast was included...unusual for USA hotels...buffet style...kind of a grab and go kind of breakfast but plenty of it...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent 4 days in NYC in early Feb this year (2016) and had spent some time looking for hotels before booking. We didn't want the hotel to cost the earth given we were there to explore the city and not spend a lot of time in the hotel, but at the same time we wanted somewhere that was pleasant and a good location. Hyatt Place was exactly this and more!The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from Times Square, 5 minutes away from Macy's and the New York Public Library is about 5 minutes up the road, so an ideal place to explore. Penn Station is also a 10 minute walk away if that so perfect for getting around the city/to and from airports. The hotel itself was quiet and welcoming. Staff were helpful and check in was super quick. We had heard rumours of resort fees, not related to this hotel but others, and we have previously travelled to Las Vegas where resort fees are everywhere, so we were prepared to be caught out. However, despite offering a free breakfast and Wi-Fi there were no resort fees, which was an added bonus. The room itself was perfect. We had a king size bed and a sofa in the room as well as a large TV and coffee/tea facilities. The bed was one of the comfiest I have ever slept in! The bathroom was great, good size with an amazing large shower. The whole room was quite modern and clean with maid service every day. It's not a luxurious hotel (felt like it catered to business people more so than tourists, which was actualyl a good thing) but it is perfect and has everything you need if you're after something clean, warm and tidy during a city break. Breakfast is free and it's a buffet style which we enjoyed - pancakes/French toast/hot options/fruit salad/cereal/pastries etc. This was an ideal start to each day as we didn't have to worry about finding a place to eat breakfast before we set out for the day. Wi-Fi was good although connections played up a bit (this could've been my phone though as the I-pad worked fine).The hotel is located on 36th Street which houses a few offices/businesses and a couple of bars. Our room faced this street but noise didn't really disturb us. Sometimes we heard the rubbish carts early at 5am but that didn't really bother us.Overall we were really pleased with our choice of hotel. Location, services and room prices were excellent and great value for money. Would definitely recommend staying here for a NYC break and would visit again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at this hotel on 2/13/16 as a family of 4. Great location (easy walk to MSG, Bryant Park, Times Square) Room was very comfortable and the free breakfast was definitely a plus. View of the Empire State Building was great.
user_name:
Sue S
Lambertville, New Jersey, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Pleasant staff, clean comfy room, lower floors in back are the quiet ones, avoid top floors and long elevator rides, staff are happy and helpful, breakfast was just enough and saved me from going out in the brutal cold weather
user_name:
Steve V
Punta Gorda, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here on my 2nd visit to New York and chose the Hyatt Place due to it being very close to 34th Street subway and within close walking distance to Times Square. A lot of attractions are within walking distance of the hotel too. I stayed on the 12th floor and found it to be relatively quiet during the night for NY. The room was a good size with a king size bed and a sofa. The included breakfast was pretty good with a selection of hot and cold items, the breakfast area was busy and I stayed off peak, so would imagine that it is very hectic during peak season! Lots of restaurants and fast food outlets close to the hotel. I would stay here again and recommend it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel, clean, well maintained, furnished with all the basic amenities. Breakfast (hot/cold buffet), mini-fridge, hair dryer and in-room safe provided in the basic price of $129 + taxes, for a queen-size bedroom. You can get a parking for appr. $40/day (all in US$). The rooms are small, but in NYC space is a premium. Our room had a small sofa, footrest, work table and chair. Big screen TV and coffeemaker were provided. Pictures on website are accurate, but are not portraying the space provided very accurately (it can be tight at times). It is on 36th street and close to Bryant Pk, Central Station, Times Square, Empire State and around the block from Macy's. I greatly recommend! Staff is very nice, obliging and greet you with a smile! It is a great value for your money, but remember that EVERYTHING is expensive on the island.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: nice spot! Excellent staff,good bars in area, close to time square and a nice walk to subway via 8th to 34th St. two block walk to 5th Ave, very good food in area. Overall great value!! Uber to JFK $62.
user_name:
Jorge D
los angeles, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Got a fantastic deal for the dates that I stayed. My room (1 king-sized bed) was more spacious than I usually expect for NYC hotels. The complimentary breakfast was great (despite being a little repetitive during my stay). The location was absolutely fantastic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed in Hyatt Place midtown south for two nights. It's very very convenient location and provides the complimentary breakfast. Also, there's a little discount for parking garage fee (self parking). I'm satisfied with them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This place is truly great. The value, staff, room, location and even breakfast were an outstanding value. If you join Hyatt's Gold Club, you get a discount and a late check out. There are tons of places to go and things to very close by. I'm headed back there next time we stay in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed a couple of days back in september 2015 as a couple. We thought this hotel was great for the value. Clean room and quiet. Friendly staff. Great location. Breakfast was awesome, including the coffee. we would stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Convenient location - Midtown Manhattan, hence quick and easy access to anywhere on Manhattan. Be it by cab or by public transportation - the subway station is at the end of the block. The Room was very clean and the bed was comfortably soft.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent property and the service from the Front Desk and Maintenance Operations are the best -- most beautiful view -- pay extra for the city view, makes it worth it -- not impressed with Hyatt reservations -- 800 number --wish they had a tub but the showers are nice

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location. The room was a bit small but useable. Up to date. Priced right for New York. Two blocks from ESB and walking distance to uptown location. Staff was great. All in all will make for a good stay.
user_name:
Daniel W
New York, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed there a couple of months before and again I think this has excellent staff, cleanliness and value for New York City. It is my "go to" at my favorite city, Great location as well. I highly recommend it .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: super cute hotel, amazing location, really helpful staff, great breakfast definetely recommended!!Few min walking from the Empire State Building ...and from our window we could see it .We had a great time at the Hyatt Place !!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Greeted by a great staff was my initial welcome on a Sunday afternoon. A pleasant welcome to New York and my first time staying at this particular Hyatt. The staff was amazing, helpful and a great sense of humor. Other Hyatt properties are great in the city, but this hotel has won my heart for the staff and the quality of the property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I had to stay for some business meetings in the Empire State Building and the Hyatt Place was very convenient as it was only a couple of blocks away. Because I also travel into NYC via Amtrak it was also convenient to Penn Station. In addition to convenience, the room was very clean and all of the staff members that I encountered were very friendly and happy to help. I had a great city view from my room and it was quite comfortable. I would definitely stay here again when in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is great, near to attractions. All staff are very nice and professional and very helpful. The breakfast is great, have fruits and hot items. The rooms are small but have enough space and are clean. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown South several times. The location is perfect for us. We travel to NYC via Amtrak. It is a short walk from Penn Station. We shop at Macy's Herald Square during many of our visits. The hotel could not be more convenient for that. There are numerous places to eat at all price points in the area. We usually walk as much as we can in the city. The walk to Broadway theaters is relatively short as well. The rooms are comfortable and adequate size. Service has always been good. Front desk staff are friendly and accommodating. The included breakfast is not fancy, but certainly sufficient. It is so convenient not to have to find a place for breakfast when it is available in the hotel. Visiting in the off-season, as we did this past weekend, the cost of the room was outstanding for New York. We routinely recommend this hotel to family and friends and expect to return again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great place to stay during the Blizzard of 2016 in NYC. The hotel kept us informed and help with us riding out the storm. They had food options and made what could have been a difficult situation very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife & I were in NYC for the big snow storm and the staff at the Hyatt Place on 36th Street did an amazing job taking care of the guests. Keep in mind that the staff was unable to get their own homes so I am sure it was a very stressful time for them. They were great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed at other hotels in the area and they all have smaller rooms, are more expensive and don't include breakfast. The staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and comfortable despite the winter storm and the hotel feels modern and very clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Fantastic location, reasonably priced hotel. Close to subway stations as well as prominent shopping, restaurants and other tourist attractions. Fast wi-fi, hot breakfast. Pretty much checks all the boxes

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is conveniently located, rates are attractive and rooms are nice. Some trainee staff messed up during my check in and that error caused me lots of grief for my extended trip onwards. However, on positive side, even during the blizzard conditions, we were taken care of

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is great. It is relatively quiet for New York, the breakfast doesn't taste like card board, and the gym is a decent size. The rooms are tasteful--not huge, but have all of the necessities. The hotel is also very clean which I appreciate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Accomodation was clean, new, great buffet breakfast included. Stafff was very helpful and friendly throughout the blizzard and its associated stress factors. Many guests had problems with the storm, trips back and forth to the airport, rebookings, etc. All handled professionally as far as I could see. Computer and printer access were very good, too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Upon arrival we were advised that our online reservation did not guarantee price nor room. The Front Desk was not concern if we were going to stay or leave and reminded us of how crowed they get . The kitchen staff recommended that we eat elsewhere... Dirty dishes left in the stairwell

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've visited NYC off and on for the past 10 years - mostly for work, but recently have spent several long weekends in the city for pleasure as well. The usual places I stay in midtown were overly pricey, so I stumbled upon this hotel. The price was very good for a "holiday" long weekend, and the location was great. I know midtown is busy and typically a place crowded with tourists, but it is also convenient if you want a central place to base in. And this hotel was in a good area. Not quite as crowded as right in times square area, and still near a number of subway lines (Herald Square station) for easy access to the city. It's half a long block and a short block from the nearest entrance, which was very nice on cold, snowy windy days! You could spend more time underground out of the weather. And if the weather is nice, it's an easy walk to popular locations and theaters.The hotel itself was quite comfortable. I booked a "city view" room and was glad I did. It puts you on a higher floor (and was only $10 more per night). This is nice if you want to be "above" a lot of the city noise, although the streets right around the hotel are not overly noisy. The hotel is small per floor - seemed like 10-12 rooms to a floor, but the rooms themselves were quite good sized for NYC (not sure why others thought they were small - they must have stayed in much more expensive hotels in NYC than I have - and usually stay in the mid-range hotels similar to Hyatt and up). I was lucky and had very quiet neighbors, so I can't say how much room noise you might hear. The elevators were very fast, and not too busy when I was coming/going. Everything worked as it should in the room. The shower (no tub in my room) was very large and didn't make a leaky mess around the bathroom like many in other rooms I've stayed in. There were lots of outlets to plug your devices into, and my king room had a sofa to sit on in addition to a desk. Wifi was very good in my room.The breakfast was adequate. It was fresh and hot/cold as it should be, but there wasn't a lot of variety. The hot foods were basically the same both mornings I ate there, but there were enough other options that you could have a variety for several mornings if you wanted to. A decent sized area for sitting/eating too, although I ate when it wasn't that crowded. But it was definitely filling and included with your room price, so that's a plus in NYC for sure.Staff were very friendly and helpful and professional.Great choice for a midtown hotel and good value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Second stay at hotel. Unlike last time early check-in unavailable. Room was on higher floor with view, much more quiet than lower floors. Both elevators working (only 1 last time). It would've received excellent had early check-in been available to refresh after 12+ hour flight and 18 hours total travel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was not familiar with NYC and took a gamble on this hotel and it was great. It is walking distance to most attractions. The staff was friendly and helpful. The "free" breakfast was very nice. I highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've been at the Hyatt Place Midtown during my Christmas holidays. The hotel located in the heart of Manhattan is perfect for a city tour. I and my family spent there 4 nights. Everything as perfect. The room was clean and very familiar. The only point was the garderobe ( the dimension was good just for 1 person) We enjoyed a good buffet breakfast, the personnel was very nice and Raul, was really kind and helpful for every need. Close to the hotel you an find whatever you old look for. Healthy food, pub, restaurant, pharmacy, Macy ........A place to,came back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located close to Empire state building and in so minutes walking distance from Times Square. Lot is a very clean and descent hotel with very clean and calm rooms and nice staff. The breakfast is really great. we specially liked the coffee.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I recently spent three nights at this Hyatt Place. The staff were enormously helpful in getting me from one destination to the next as well as getting me airport transportation in 3 minutes. The location is excellent as well
user_name:
Valerie G
Mountain View, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Standard Hyatt hospitality: fast check in, nice big rooms, excellent staff, hot breakfast. They have a little pantry in the reception where you can get muffins, cold sandwich etc. There is a restaurant menu in room which is 24 X 7 but we did not use it. Location is a few minutes walking from times square and macy's. Breakfast timing is 6-9 on weekdays and 7-10 on weekends and a wide variety available. We booked a king room which had a sofa, small refrigerator and was soundproof. Only thing is the elevator which are 2 for 23 floors, so you can imagine the rush during breakfast time. All in all, we loved our stay there and would love to come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was phenomenal. We had an incredibly enjoyable time during our 4 days in NYC, and that was thanks a great deal to this hotel. The location was optimal. We were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go, including Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Grand Central, and the shops along 5th Avenue. Thats not even to mention that the hotel had plenty of good food options near by, and is only two blocks from the Empire State Building. We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room (free upgrade as a result of being a Hyatt Gold Passport Platinum member), and it was lit up red and green during most of our stay. The staff at the hotel was kind and courteous, allowed for a late check-out, and even offered to set up departure transportation had we needed it. Overall this hotel was great, and I look forward to returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent a long weekend in NY and booked at Hyatt Place because of it's central location. It's an easy walk to Times Square and Fifth Avenue. The room are very clean and the breakfast buffet was good to get you off for the day. The hotel is small and does not have a restaurant, so that may matter to you. But all in all it is a great place to stay if you are going to be out and about for the day. It is not a luxury destination, but that is not it's purpose. Know what you want before booking.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Rooms are large, beds comfortable. Hotel is clean. Staff is very polite and goes out of their way to be accommodating. Small extras (water bottle when arriving, outlets on night table) are nice perks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Fifth Ave is at the top of the street with an array of shops, bars, and restaurants close by. Hotel is clean and rooms are spacious, tea and coffee making facilities in the room, ironing board, safe and free WiFi. Fast elevator to all floors, decent buffet breakfast, eggs, waffles, toast, cereal, fresh fruit, tea and speciality teas and coffee. Staff friendly would recommend. Due to central location, traffic can be heard from 8th floor, fridge and air condition noisy

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was in a convenient and safe area with walking distance to time square, shopping, dining, parks ... etc. It was also a short taxi ride to the Javits Center where I was exhibiting at a travel show. Being in the tourism and hospitality industry, I was impressed by the spacious room size, all amenities including an awesome breakfast, WiFi access, friendly staff and most importantly the amazing view of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Comfortable accommodations, a great location, and a fabulous staff! I was impressed with how helpful everyone was. The free breakfast was kind of a zoo, so I opted to go for breakfast elsewhere, but the Hyatt Place was perfect for me.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A very nice option at a reasonable price in a good location. Need I say more?All around I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. I had seen the exterior on a prior NYC visit and thought it might be worth a try. The location is good -- half a block west of 5th Avenue -- and overall it seemed to be a quiet street for midtown Manhattan. Arrival was good and the the check in quick with a very friendly staff. However when I went into the room it was not exactly what I booked. Since it was just a one night stay I figured it was not worth the effort but I mentioned it at the front desk and they insisted on making it right. They blamed Hyatt.com for not giving them complete information and even when I said I did not want to take the time/effort to move my bags they insisted and said they would happily move everything for me. They could have said well as long as you are not upset ....and left me where I was.The room was very comfortable. I booked the king bed room and while it is not large it was very good. What I really liked is it had a sofa in the window so you had a place to sit other than the less comfortable desk chair or the bed. Many of the hotels in this rate category don't have a comfy chair in the room so this was a real bonus. There was a small but workable desk, big tv and a good bed. I don't look for a frige but there was one in the room if that matters to you. Bathroom was equally serviceable with a large shower.Everything looked clean. There were some small signs of wear but nothing that was upsetting or made you hesitate.Added feature of the hotel is they include breakfast for the guests. It had a good selection of cold cereal, fruit, hot oatmeal, egg sandwiches, pancakes, breads with a toaster and coffee and tea. It is not the most elaborate but its included and no one will go hungry. (Note to management individual serve yogurt would be a good addition as opposed to an open bowl .... also better food safety.)Price wise the hotel was a few dollars more than competing products in the same area but for the room comfort I would say it is worth it versus some of the others I had stayed at in the same area.All the interactions with the staff were very friendly and them seemed genuinely interested in making sure you had a nice stay.Really no complaints ..... I plan to stay here again when I am in Manhattan!
user_name:
Frequentraveler_724
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My first few experiences at the Hyatt NY Midtown were fine - nice clean rooms and friendly service. I was there again last week and it was a COMPLETELY different experience this time !! The staff was hot mess. They could not get the check ins correct for my co-worker and I. The Air / heat in the room did not work at all and I had to wait for 1/2 hr to get someone up to repair... which they did not do correctly so it was hot in the room all night !! The Shower did not work !! AND to top it all off.... I woke up with huge welts all over my legs from BED BUG bites !! I informed the staff and they were apologetic and said the manager would contact me... I gave them my business card... but NEVER heard back from anyone. Way to go staff ! Overall - very unhappy with this stay :(

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I spent 3 days at this fabulously located New York Hyatt. The first person to greet us was "Rich", the go-to everything guy; concierge, bellman, metro adviser, hotel navigator and an overall sweetheart.We loved New York, the Hyatt and Rich.We will return again and again!!!Thank you Rich.Love, Donna and Stewart

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent 8 nights at this hotel and are really satisfied with our stay. Check-in and check-out are efficient and professional. The room is spacious enough for New York with a sofa. There is a safe but not enough cupboards to store your clothes and stuff. The room was clean and neat, we recommend a high floor not to be disturbed by the street noise. You are 3 minutes from Macy's. Breakfast is good but unfortunately it has been the same food during our whole stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The people is so friendly, the location is incredible, the bedroom was huge for a Manhattan hotel, the breakfast was really good. The only thing to improve is the elevator (only 2 for 23 floors) and the breakfast time, they should close at a determinate time to avoid all the people in the last minute.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I wanted to grab a hotel last minute to hang out with some friends. It was in a great location and was also easily accessible from the local subway. The hotel was clean and so was the room; however, I rated it a three because the room did not have complimentary shower caps, lotions and toothbrushes. When we called to the front desk to ask for it soap and other necessary items, they made me come down from my room to pick it up. Otherwise, I had a great stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We drove to the city and arrived very early in the morning on Christmas Eve. We did not use the parking that was available through the hotel because I found a place around the corner that was a little cheaper, however, we had to carry all of our belongings the 2-3 blocks from the parking area to the hotel and the less you have to drive in downtown, the better, so the extra money may be well spent for not having to endure those inconveniences. Upon arrival, they did not have my reservation from booking.com (which I normally call the hotel and double check, but don't usually have any problems with so I guess it slipped my mind this time), luckily the gentleman behind the counter gave us what we needed after I showed him my print out from booking.com. Thank God they even had any empty rooms! Not only that, he checked us in and told us we could go to our room and get breakfast at the buffet if we wanted!!! I kept waiting for some extra charges to show up on the bill due to these things, but there were no extra charges!! The car was cramped on our 7 hour car ride and I get frazzled from city driving, so I was extremely grateful and we promptly ate and took a nap. The location was wonderful and within walking distance of everything we needed. Our room was on the 12th floor and was spacious enough for the 5 of us with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. There was also a fridge. If you craned your neck you could see the top section of the empire state building. I never saw any housekeepers, maybe because of the holiday, but there was a fully stocked cart in the hallway both days. When we went to check-out, the hotel was gracious enough to hold our bags until we returned so that we did not have to lug everything with us or cut our trip short because of this. This made me extremely happy!! Everyone we had contact with was very nice and I feel this hotel was a great deal. The only negative things I have to say are that the buffet isn't amazing, but it is way more than most hotels offer in the area for free and the added value for a family is worth it. Also, the elevators are super slow and need to be updated or something, but there's always the stairs Very happy with our stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed in many hotels in and around NY during my earlier visits. Without any doubt, this is the best hotel. Location is perfect, as the herald sq. Metro is just behind the hotel. Commute will not be an issue at all. The overall service is awesome. Breakfast is really good with many choices available. Normally the breakfast area become a little crowded After 8:30... ☺. Macy's super store, Manhattan mall, B&H, Empire state building, times sq. etc are within walkable distance...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the hotel for a week (on the second week of June) and I can tell three things, location, location and location, the hotel located on W 36th Street, between 5th and 6th Avenues, in the heart of Midtown South (Bryant Park, Times Square, the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Central park and Broadway are all a short walk).In addition, the service was excellent, Large, clean and quiet room with free wifi.In the morning, breakfast is served.In short, I highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved this hotel. We wanted a quick getaway and took the train to NYC. Customer service was excellent. Hotel was clean and we liked that breakfast was included in the rate. Hotel is close to Penn Station and Times Square and Rockefeller Center.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt was conveniently located in mid-town -near Herald Square subway, shops and restaurants. We were on 14th floor and did not hear any noise from streets below. Room had a super comfortable bed, was very clean and the shower was large and had great water pressure. Not much "extra" room around the bed and desk, but we were not there to stay in the room for long periods of time. The breakfast was a little crowded, but worth it - lots of choices and very filling! It's nice to get a free breakfast when rooms in NY are so expensive with all the taxes added on! The staff was very nice and we recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This place is fantastic, centrally located in the heart of everything and I do mean everything, shopping, train station, pubs/bars. Staff were amazing and very helpful. Room was adequate in relation to New York standards! Would definitely recommend this resort to anyone visiting New York, we were on a very high floor and had an amazing view of the city lights.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For my all business trips, I staying in this place for past 4 years. Great and Convenient place in center of NY city. Very clean and family friendly hotel. Friendly staff and free Breakfast buffet. Close to world famous Empire State building and many more places. Conveniently located with all the required facilities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was pleased with the location of this Hotel. I have stayed at the Hyatt Place in Waikiki and was disappointed in the differences of the Hotels. It was not that the room was small but it was the lack of attention to small details that bothered me the most. Things like a shower cap and extra blankets were not in the room. Garbage bags were not in the trash cans. The customer service was average in all areas. The breakfast was appreciated but not a great variety of foods. Perhaps I should not have compared it. The Hyatt Place in Waikiki. The Self-Parking was close by and very reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location and staff (except for in the kitchen) was friendly. We only stayed there because we had points to use up. I wouldn't normally pay that much for an average room, but again, the location was great and by NYC standards, the room was a good size. Our only issue was with the almost nonexistent breakfast we tried to get when we got back from running at 9 AM. We were able to get a tiny bit of oatmeal and toast right as the staff was taking everything away. They were actually sort of rude trying to take everything away as quickly as possible before anyone could get anything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice location, big rooms with sofa pull out bed. Very helpful front desk staff. Overall its a nice place to stay for couple of days. No microwave. Could not check in early, it would have been nice if I could check-in early especially after a long flight.
user_name:
Vijendra P
Greenville SC, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is new, room was clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Request a room on the upper levels to avoid street noise. Great location with easy access to train, bus, subway and taxi. Several great restaurants and pub within walking distance.
user_name:
Frances D
New York, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After several stays at the 36th Street Hyatt Midtown, it has become our preferred New York City choice. While recently the Hyatt regency actually offered a slightly lower rate, we still chose Hyatt Place. (We'll stay at the San Francisco Hyatt Regency in 4 weeks). Service, rooms, location are just right, and the staff courteous and professional. All in all, just right!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A nice place to stay in the city - central, but quiet on the upper floors. It was a very good deal for December in the city. The usual Hyatt quality and very pleasant and efficient staff. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived early, but they took our bags while we visited the Morgan Library and other nearby attractions. On our return, the desk clerk immediately recognized us and handed us our keys. Made us feel at home.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: New York is a tight on space but done right it can do wonders. This Hyatt place means business -24 hrs coffee shop, welcoming staff, breakfast inclusive. The rooms may feel small but at NYC standards they just fine. Clean & well appointed rooms. Thats how much you get for your money's worth ;p

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I booked this Hotel for annual sisters weekend in NYC because our usual hotel was completely booked. I wasn't sure about the location but hoped for the best. The Hotel staff was extremely welcoming and attentive when we checked in and as we left for dinner we realized how perfect the location was...right around the corner from Macy's and their Charlie Brown Christmas Display. Awesome! We were close to everything. We were close to great restaurants and shopping (my sisters favorite pastime). Breakfast was really done well; serving scrambled eggs, sausage, scrambled eggs with peppers and onions & cheese, waffles/French toast. Plenty of options in the morning. Rooms were nice, clean and with a full pull out bed in our room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staying at the Hyatt Place on 36th Street in Manhattan was a great experience. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are well appointed, the free buffet breakfast had lots of food options, the location is convenient to everything, many rooms have a view of the Empire State Building, the staff is friendly and the cost was quite affordable for Manhattan. The next time we visit Manhattan, we definitely know where we are going to stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a nice clean hotel close to Times Square. Wi fi is fast and free, rooms are a good size for Manhattan with a couch and desk area. Refrigerators in room as well and large bathroom. Free breakfast in the morning too. Two issues...they do not provide bottles of water in the room and there are only 2 elevators, so if you are on the 24th floor, there could be quite a wait during peak periods. Also there are no suites, so using suite upgrade awards for diamond members not available.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had to be in NYC for a meeting. Booked a night at the Hyatt Place. It's a great location. Ten minute walk from Penn Station and centrally located to the office where I had my meeting. Place is clean and the rooms are fairly big for a place in downtown New York. We arrived at the hotel around 1 pm, but the room was not ready. Left my luggage and headed out to have lunch and meeting. Did not return to the hotel until later in the evening. There are many restaurants around to each. It's a great location...close to subway and train station.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 6 nights, and staff and hotel met our exceptions. The staff were all very friendly, especially Raul and Leslie who looked after our every need. Great place to stay, the location can't be beat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent hotel located on 36th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues. Easy to walk to pretty much all attractions. Plenty of restaurants in the area to suit all tastes. The Free a.m. Kitchen Skillet offers a lot of breakfast items.
user_name:
cwg2013
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our first time in the hyatt midtown.. first impressions were very good location only 4 blocks from bryant park maybe 15 minute walk to times square which we did almost everynight also 1 block away from the biggest macys..VS.. and (R) subway station which takes you all the way downtown. reception was small but nice check in was very quick and easy. originally we booked the suite as there was meant to be 5 of our party as 1 had to cancel we stuck with the same room for 4 of us 2 couples. Upon entering the room we were shocked at how small it was! if there was a fifth person we would of 100% complained if we had to open the sofa bed there was no room to even walk to the other side of the room... very tight rooms and bathrooms I have stayed in new york before and I was aware hotels are usually small but there was no way this could fit 5 or 6 people in!! ... the wardrobe was also tiny only enough room for 1 persons clothes so the other 3 of us had to live out of our suitcases which were placed on the couch and floor as there is no storage, tv was good lots of channels, water pressure really good, had a small view of empire state building which was good.Breakfast was ok small variety not bad for free, we prefered to go around the corner for mcmuffins. 6 days was ok in this hotel no problems.... unit we checked out.. booked this hotel through booking.com in the small print the price excludes city and state tax.. we asked for our receipt to find out it had actually doubled in price what it didn't say on our booking was the tax was per person PER NIGHT! beware when checking out always ask for your receipt! , we did got our 5th persons money knocked off and they changed the rate to a lower rate... still a lot more than we expected. not bad for 6 nights but would no stay again. (ps wifi was great)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We found this hotel to be located perfectly for walking all over Manhattan. The staff were very caring and professional. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast every morning. Our only problem was a noisy ventilation sytem in our room. I would recommend this hotel for your Manhattan vacation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall good experience, but very disappointed with response to requests for service. Maid service was inconsistent, and somewhat intrusive. I have come to expect more from Hyatt while earning my Platinum status. This hotel falls short of meeting those expectations.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I would stay here gain. Nice location Very nice staff. Room was great and breakfast was very good and Free made it even better. Don't know how much i can say lol they are making me use 200 characters . So hope you enjoy as much as we did

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is located in a great part of the city with easy access to mid-town sights. I had a very comfortable stay -- the room was clean and the staff was terrific. I would recommend it for either business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location to stay, not in the middle of every thing, but not too far away either. Definitely would stay here again. Friendly staff, decent breakfast and good size clean rooms. You will not be disappointed. Enjoyed our stay can't wait to come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location in midtown, from the room you can see the Empire State. All services worked very good, friendly people at front desk my kids were very happy mostly during breakfast with variety of cereals.I recommend it

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was clean and comfortable. I had a nice view of the Empire State Building. The skillets breakfast in the morning was good. Location was good, near a lot of subway lines, stores, Penn Station, and Madison Square Garden.
user_name:
paddlinkid
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My 2 children and I stayed 1 night in New York and were able to do all we planned while staying at the Hyatt Place Mid town. We walked everywhere, saved money on breakfast, parked next door and enjoyed every minute!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This Hyatt is the best, quiet and convenient location near Penn Station. Staff is very friendly at the front desk and throughout. Raul really helped with luggage and front lobby area. Complementary breakfast and Wifi appreciated. Will stay here again when in NYC.
user_name:
Robert K
Georgetown SC, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect balance of location, comfort and price. Walking distance to all midtown attractions. Both, Breakfast places and bars really closeParking 50 yards from hotel, paid at hotel during checkout. My room was at 23rd floor with stunning views of Manhattan, really clean and relatively spacious.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Friendly, clean hotel with WIFI and breakfast included. I travel frequently to this area for business and stay at several different hotels this would be my first choice for any future travel. The room is quiet and clean. The bed is comfortable. The WIFI speed was better than expected. The area was close to restaurants, Times Square and other features.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had an enjoyable three day stay at this hotel. The room was perfect in every way. The breakfast was good, but food is sparce during the last hour. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom spotless and well supplied. The hotel is located between 6th and 5th Avenues and convenient to mid-town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed here a few times. Always friendly service, good rooms at a good price and convenient location. Very good Wifi and free breakfast. Near Empire State Building, Macy's, Penn Station, Herald Square and really everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were very pleased with our room, the hotel, the meal plan, and the very friendly and helpful staff. After the first night we felt as if we were coming home as we were greeted with a welcome back! The breakfast buffet was plentiful and the selection was good, especially on the weekends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is the second time I have stayed at this Hyatt Place. First time was 2 years agoand we really liked it! 2 years ago we got snowed in in NYC (we were happy that we were forced to stay an extra day because LGA cancelled our flights. At the time we asked Raoul and the woman at the desk (can't remember her name) if we could stayan extra night. They said yes, and would help us with anything else we needed. Theytook very good care of us and we enjoyed another play and more fun in the city.I am back for a second time and so happy to find out Raoul was back! He was evenmore accomodating this time -- (and said he remembered our last stay -- well, he saidthe right thing, even if it was or wasn't true!!!!)Again, he helped with with the "little" things.... helped me check in my vest right at thefront office so I wouldn't have to carry it back upstairs and the next day he pointed outthe microwave so I could reheat my coffee. Someone had left it a mess and he gladly cleaned it out for me...I was afraid it might start on fire because there was grease in it.Anyway, I want to say this - employees are fabulous! Breakfast was very good and they kept everything full and fresh, the room cleanliness couldn't have been better!Sorry to be so wordy, but they deserve congratulations for top notch service in a "lower Price" category of hotels. Thank you again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a gem - we were completely unaware of its existence before we came.I think the area has been gentrified in the past several years as there are a number of hotels now in the area. The staff is professional, friendly, and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place is located a few blocks from Penn Station.It's not large but has modern, clean & comfortable rooms.The hotel is a narrow high-rise on a busy back street next to other similar hotels.The staff are friendly & helpful.A full breakfast is included, which is adequate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location was literally in the shadows of the Empire State bldg. The service at the front desk was awesome. Wanted to mention Kamesha, at the reception, whose very friendly and very professional demeanor gave our weekend stay a great start. The central location made it easy to walk to Chelsea Market on Saturday and then uptown towards Central Park on Sunday. Will come back next trip.
user_name:
TCWASHDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is fresh and new and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. I would recommend it highly for those traveling to the city for work or pleasure. It's a short walk to Times Square and literally hundreds of restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location. Rooms small but very convenient, clean, modern furniture, everything one would need. Friendly and helpful hotel staff. Full breakfast but in a youth hostel atmosphere. CAUTION: Hotel will validate parking ticket by Meyers Parking Garage at 12 West 36 Street. Our car was damaged but Garage denied our valid claim by presenting a forged pre-park survey ticket that we never saw nor signed. Insist on real pre-park survey ticket when leaving your car.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were celebrating our anniversary with my wife, and the team did it great in helping prepare the room with some presents I bought. Also they send a wonderful wine, some cupcakes and they gave us a wonderful room with an exceptional view of the Empire State. It has been an exceptional experience thanks to the help of Charmaine, Marlinne and Sarfaraz. Highly recommended hotel!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown South for one night as part of a business trip to New York. The hotel is located close to Penn Station and Herald Square, so access to Amtrak and the subway is really conenient, especially if you have a suitcase in tow. I was eagerly greeted at the front desk and checked in quickly. I was expecting a small room but was very pleasantly surprised at the size and updated decor. The room itself was large enough for a king bed, desk and small sofa and the bathroom was a nicely sized as well. The entire property is modern and seems new or recently refurbished. A hot breakfast was also included in and for the price and location, I thought it was a terrific value,.
user_name:
cpchester
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at this Hyatt Place. The location near Macy's and Harald Square is excellent. Easy to get anywhere from there. My room was very comfortable -- surprisingly roomy for a NY hotel. I was on a high floor with a nice view of Manhattan. The front desk staff were very welcoming. I had good conversations with two of them. My only issue was with the breakfast. Both times I tried to eat there the coffee and food was wiped out. The tables were covered with dirty plates. No servers were around. This was despite showing up during the hours they recommend for breakfast. Seems they are either short staffed or have the wrong staff. Despite this I'd stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Clean, great location, friendly staff, excellent hot breakfast with fruit/yogurt/etc. Bed was really comfortable with fluffy pillows. Coffee and tea available in the room - good quality. Have a fridge to store cold beverages and leftover food was very convenient and appreciated. I didn't get a chance to use the fitness room. I would certainly stay here ago....Great Location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place is a perfect location for your NY visit - walking distance to many attractions.The staff is very friendly and attentive. Complimentary breakfast is included, the perfect way to start our day. We especially enjoyed the tour of the NYC Public Library.
user_name:
Marsha G
Palo Alto, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Superb staff, great place to stay with family, centrally located.& if we are visiting New York City again will definitely stay here. We Indians pride ourselves for our warm hospitality, but got to see & feel it at the hyatt place. Felt at home & at ease.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Considering the other options in midtown Manhattan, this hotel was an affordable option in the heart of it all. Great views of the empire state building and walking distance to MSG. They have reliable internet and a nice hot breakfast buffet. The buffet also includes lots of healthy options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect place to take it all in while in Times Square. Easy walk to Central Park, shopping, Times Square, Broadway and Bryant Park. The free breakfast is an added bonus and saved us $25 per day. Great view of the Empire State Building with some of the rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: While the rooms were small, there was a desk, sofa, king bed, free wify, fantastic view of skyline from floor to ceiling, wall to wall window. Everyone on the staff went out of their way to be helpful and friends. Loved the breakfast--especially the generous grapefruit sections. I did miss having a tub. Price was reasonable although it changed for each day for the 5 days I was there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location and is very easy to get in and out of. Clean and well kept. Attentive staff. Comfortable beds/rooms. It is nice to stay in a relatively small hotel, in a big city, but still have big hotel services and amenities on a manageable scale. Hyatt standards are excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Visiting NY a lot I have stayed at several Hotels and many of my stays at the Hyatt Place which is always a great experience with friendly staff beautiful rooms, extremely comfortable beds all coupled with a great all-inclusive Hot Breakfast Buffet.Great Value! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: While using rewards for 2 nights, checked out after a day and my credit card was charged for a night also! And, after contacting the hotel via phone, the account manager did not reply to my phone message (after 8 hours)!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: When looking for a hotel in NYC, it can be overwhelming since there are so many to choose from but I chose Hyatt Place in Midtown due to its location to everything and access to the subways. I found a coupon through Costco and was able to get a rate for around $330/night. The rooms are not too large but that's expected when staying in Manhattan. I also liked how there was free internet and a full breakfast. When reading reviews on TA, I was concerned regarding the complaints about the wait time for the elevator, but we never had a to wait for more than 2 minutes even during the peak breakfast time and most times there was a very short wait for it. There's only 8 rooms per floor so it's not like you're staying in a massive hotel with only two functioning elevators. Also, my only concern was that our room was never cleaned when we stayed there. Granted, we are from Los Angeles and were late risers, but still, our room was never cleaned even though we were gone for several hours at a time. We saw the housekeeping cart outside and saw her cleaning the other rooms when we would leave but she never cleaned our room for some reason.The hotel has a great location and is right off Herald Square and close walking distance to major sites including Macy's, the Flatairon Building, the Empire State Building and Times Square. Another thing I liked was that there wasn't too much noise at night (we stayed on the 18th floor), which is rare for a hotel in Midtown but I think it's because it's off 36th St. which isn't a majorly chaotic street. I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt and Sheraton by Times Square before and remember I could still hear noise from the streets even though we were staying towards the top of the building.Just a tip, when leaving JFK airport, take the AirTrain to Jamaica Station then take the Long Island Railroad into Penn Station and walk about 10 minutes to the hotel. Don't take the subway into the city because that was brutal and took over an hour to reach Penn Station with so many stops. When we arrived we asked someone at the info desk at JFK about how to get into the city because we didn't want to pay $70 for a taxi and she advised us to take the E line but that was completely wrong and a waste of time. The LIRR will get you to Penn Station in about 15-20 minutes with two stops only.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I will start by saying that we are Diamond Hyatt travelers, so we are loyal to this chain. Normally I stay at the Grand Hyatt, but the cost was prohibitive. This is a newer property for the chain, but was another hotel before. It was great! The location is perfect, just blocks to Penn Station so easy access to everything. The staff were great and extremely helpful. Rooms were pretty spacious by NYC standards, there were 3 of us and it was really comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a modern moderately priced midtown hotel and good for the purpose, business or tourist. Manhattan can be a confusing and threatening place. Owing to the smiley staff and especially a guy called Raul who helped me at very turn it is the sort of place I am inclined to book for future visits and recommend to my friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown South. Could not have asked for a better location and better staff. All were extremely accommodating and friendly. Someone even waited out in the rain to flag us down a taxi, as we had left ours and they had run out of loaners.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for the NYC Marathon and everything was perfect. Reasonable rate and ideal location. Walked to expo at Javitts center. Walked to Times Square.
