review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was a great central base for visiting New York. The Empire State, Times Square and Macey's are all within walking distance. The room and bathroom were clean and tidy, my only comments would be that the external windows were very dirty. Breakfast was adequate for our needs with hot and cold food, juice and coffee.Our room was on the 9th floor facing the road which did have some road noise but our overall stay was very enjoyable and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Clean quiet room with comfortable bed. Great breakfast with great variety included in the stay at the hotel. It was a great find in NYC at a great price! Monique at the front desk was very helpful in getting copies made of documents I needed while staying there. We accidentally left our laptop charger in the room. Housekeeping recovered it and were very quick to accommodate and help us to get it returned. Great experience and very helpful staff!
user_name:
MikefromTexas
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I usually stay at the Grand Hyatt because it's closer to the office, however I have been increasingly disappointed by that location so I decided to try this hotel out. First, the location is very handy. I did not have time to do much sightseeing, however the location is very close to a couple of subway stations and it's easy to get around. The room I stayed in was excellent -- very clean with nice furnishings. I was even given a room with a pretty decent view as well. I ate breakfast here twice and was pleased. The fresh fruit was perfect for me and I enjoyed the hot selections as well. I ate dinner here twice as well and was very pleased with the food. Even more important, all of the staff I encountered were pleasant, helpful, and just a joy to interact with. I'll definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here in June 2015 and had a nice stay. The rooms were clean and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. The room was also very quiet and we slept well. One area for improvement would be the friendliness of the front desk staff upon check-in. Maybe it's a NYC thing but they seemed a bit brusque. I've seen friendlier service at other locations. But all in all, we had a good stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For $379 a night ($439 including tax), I got a small room with a comfortable bed but non-working TV. Next AM, waited nearly fifteen minutes for elevator before walking eight floors with my bags to check out. Never again. Shame on Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good central location, friendly helpful staff and reasonable value. The room was of a good size and comfortably furnished. The only downside was that although breakfast was included in the room rate, the choice for a hot breakfast was quite limited and we probably would have been better off eating breakfast elsewhere. That said, we would certainly choose this hotel again for any future visits. Also, because of our Hyatt Club membership, we were allowed a 2pm checkout which suited our departure arrangements perfectly. The concierge also arranged a car service to the NJ airport for $USD80, flat rate. Given the issues of taxis/limos crossing state lines we felt this was reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Not sure the rate because we traveled for business, staff at desk was very friendly. We were able to get cabs and see quite a bit from the central location. the bed was comfortable and view was great from floor 19, the empire state building literally right outside the window. Breakfast was included and it was decent. Coffee was good. The bathroom was nice with a clean and updated shower. I would stay again if we needed to be in that area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I searched high and low for a hotel in Manhattan with two queen-size beds and a sofa sleeper for a family of 5 - this hotel has it! It also comes with a hot cooked breakfast; a must for a family traveling with 3 kids in NYC. The room was not big, but it was comfortable and we all had the space we needed to sleep. One tip: bring an outlet strip for charging devices, as there were not many outlets in the room. We were on the sixth floor facing the side and had virtually no street noise. The front desk staff was extremely helpful with subway directions and restaurant suggestions, and had a baggage hold service which we used our last day there. They also leave dishes out and accessible, as well as a microwave, so if you bring back leftovers, you can warm them in the kitchen-area microwave on real plates. I would have enjoyed having coffee and tea service left out all the time, but there is a small coffee maker in the room. We found the black-out shades helpful, and were also glad we were only on the sixth floor as one of the elevators was not working one day, causing a real headache in this 26-floor property. The location is excellent - just a block or so from Macy's, and not far from Bryant Park and the Empire State Building. It's not spacious or cheap, but if you need to sleep and feed five in Manhattan, this place does the trick nicely.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is very well located for walking or catching a subway. The room was large for NY, clean, good beds and linens and quiet. All in all, a very comfortable stay. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly and arranged many requests for us. Good choice in New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was clean and had plenty of linens as well as a nice bed. The Kitchen Skillet breakfast was excellent! The closet door wouldn't close all the way, and the faucet on the sink flopped about when you tried to use it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As a family of 2 adults and 3 kids, 5-12yrs, finding an economical-yet-also-decent lodging in the city is difficult. Hyatt Place Midtown fit the bill! Quarters were still a bit cramped, and we wish they had more drawer storage, but included-breakfast, central location, and safe, clean, comfortable rooms made this place hard to beat! When traveling as a 5-er, I'd stay here again! Oh, and the Empire State view from 1603 was pretty awesome!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is within walking distance to Times Square. 5 minutes away from subway- Herald Square Station. The entire place is very tidy and clean. The room is spacious - King size bed with a LG flat screen tv, a sofa, writing table, iron and ironing board and hair dryer. Water pressure in the bathroom is acceptable. Wi fi connection in the room is speedy. The hotel staff are very friendly and polite. When engaged in a conversation, there were eye contact from the staff. It was our first time staying in this hotel to celebrate our Silver Anniversary. The service and the room was beyond our expectation. Wow! Keep up the good job! Cheers! :) Lawrence & Selina

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved my one night stay here on Hyatt points for a half day's R&R. Pssst, think this is Hyatt's answer to that nice Marriott Fairfield next to Penn Station that is also a great hotel (see my earlier review), because the Hyatt Place was only a 10-15 minute walk from arriving on Amtrak. A new budget hotel that felt pretty luxurious considering that it was clean, quiet, close to everything in midtown and 2 blocks from the subway at 34th St. Staff were super nice and gave me a room on the 16th floor. Loved the room layout and big sofa, and more space than many Manhattan hotels. And shocking- the free breakfast was pretty decent with Starbucks coffee and edible food- something you don't stumble upon much these days. Slept well too. Thanks Hyatt for this little gem in midtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel staff was great and very helpful. They helped with taxis and tickets to Big Bus. They always greeted you when you came down and left the hotel. Amenities were great such as complimentary breakfast, Gallery Dining and Stop and Go area. Nice place downstairs and outside to sit and enjoy the city. Computers and ATM downstairs were very helpful. Hotel was centrally located.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Really enjoyed this location. The staff is great and the rooms are really nice. My only complaint was that there was a balcony on the top floor which was locked. I really wish I had been able to go out on that balcony and have a cigar or something. It was a really good view. 5 minutes from 30 rock, 10 minutes from times square (if you are into that) and there is a subway right around the corner. I would recommend this to anyone with the coin to spend, or the points to spend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I always research before a stay in the city and this hotel didn's disappoint. I was concerned on first arrival as there appeared to be an issue, but on the contrary my check-in was smooth and professional. I was particularly impressed with the way my request for a change was handled - I believe the gentleman that checked me in was Dana? Excellent service. Room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great place to stay. Clean room. Comfortable and updated. Nice lobby with area outside to relax. Very convenient location. Great central location for seeing the city. The staff was great. Breakfast was excellent. Hope to stay here again. Everything I have come to expect from Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Clean, compact, hotel with very friendly and helpful staff! Excellent hot breakfast. Nice lobby. Room was small, but had fridge and hot water for tea or coffee and plenty of outlets and was nicely decorated in neutral tones. Location was convenient.
user_name:
Edith F
New York, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff was extremely attentive and courteous - even at midnight when I finally made it to the hotel after a delayed flight. They offered me a late checkout without my asking. The breakfast buffet had a lot of choices and was very well staffed. They were constantly refilling the offerings. The bell hop was also very courteous and helped me find my way to various services within the hotel. The only negative did not have anything to do with the hotel. There was utility construction in the street outside and they dropped of containers extremely early in the morning which was very noisy.
user_name:
Elaine P
Kansas City, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I spent my last night of a seven night stay here at Hyatt Place. It was like an oasis compared to the other hotel. It was relatively quiet, business center was functional, breakfast was included, Internet was free, bottle of water offered at check-in, nice staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location was superb but traffic around the hotel was terrible. Parking is very expensive, Service at the reception was great. Had to call for towels and toilet paper every day. Breakfast is provided as part of the stay and one day the staff lengthened the availability due to elevator problems, That was very good of the staff to do so.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was simply awesome, it was so new, fresh and clean! Were New Yorkers our selves but sometimes its nice to have a night in a different place so we picked this hotel for our one night get away. When we arrived our room wasn't ready and we left our bags in the bag drop room and left to take a quick walk to Starbucks when we came back our room was ready and we were promptly given the keys, now here is my only problem, the room is small, yes I get that were in the city but the room was pretty tight, although it was tight it was laid out just perfectly and was more then functional for our needs. After a night in a different part of the city then were usually in this hotel provided us a great night sleep and a great breakfast in the morning following. Now I wouldn't call this hotel romantic or anything special, but for us cleanliness and modern amenities is huge and this hotel has that. If we want another quick stay in midtown this is our number one choice.
user_name:
Matt H
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The back story on my stay is simple. Amtrak was down due to crash and ended up traveling to NYC early for a meeting since I had to ride the bus. This was a last minute purchase and not cheap.Room:I had two double beds and a view North. Nothing to take photos of, but light shined in throughout the morning.Nice couch, awkward TV viewing. Bed was really the best option.No hot water. Apparently an issue on the block. Front desk was pretty relaxed about this issue. I was trying to get to a meeting and for $700 a night, I would expect hot water or some notice that it would be missing. Free breakfast. Didn't do it, just got my free coffee.Elevators are painfully slow. Read my reviews and you would know I never complain about this. For a newish/renovated hotel, they should run like clockwork. At one point it was a good 10 min wait to get back to my room. Totally odd.Location is pretty good. Accessible to Penn Station, ESB, and Subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here a couple of nights for a business trip last year, and the staff was very welcoming - as expected from Hyatt. Very nice and modern rooms and atmosphere, and when the location is on 36th street in the middle of everything in NYC, you can't really go wrong. Couldn't hear any noise from the street while staying, something which can be an issue in other hotels in NYC.Thumbs up, will stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice large rooms especially for Manhattan. Very good breakfast included and spacious breakfast area. Area was a little loud due to construction but still got a great nights sleep. Very helpful and nice desk staff. Left my running watch in the room and they 2nd day aired it to me. Loved the location. Close to Broafway Times Square etc but still quiet. Outstanding customer service. I'll go out of my way to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location with easy access to Herald Square, subway, Penn Station, the major bus lines and the Empire State Building. Spacious rooms, especially for NYC with one whole wall of windows with wonderful views and great light. Staff is welcoming and extremely helpful. Excellent value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was a great price and in the heart of the garment district. Staff was friendly and helpful, room was clean and had a small couch too. Free breakfast & workout room. The room was not fancy, but I felt the room was well worth the price I paid.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at a higher floor and we were looking right at the Empire State Building from our bed. The lobby is clean and breakfast is very good with hot and cold food items. The room we were in is spacious with two queen beds and a sleeper sofa. Spacious in Manhattan near Times Square means there is room for more than the beds, which includes sitting areas and a work desk plus some ground space. The location is literally 5 minutes walk from Times Square, which makes it very convenient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at a higher floor and we were looking right at the Empire State Building from our bed. The lobby is clean and breakfast is very good with hot and cold food items. The room we were in is spacious with two queen beds and a sleeper sofa. Spacious in Manhattan near Times Square means there is room for more than the beds, which includes sitting areas and a work desk plus some ground space. The location is literally 5 minutes walk from Times Square, which makes it very convenient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our room was huge and the hotel is well localized, very near to the Times Square, Macy’s, (you can go on feet, if you want). I have no complaints regarding the room; it was clear, comfortable and has an efficient heater. Good breakfast and service. People are kind and helpful.
user_name:
Fred F
State of Rio de Janeiro

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We recently had a five night stay at this hotel. The hotel itself was clean and modern. Rooms also very clean and spacious enough. I really appreciated the in room couch, and the empire state veiw wasn´t too bad either. The bed was very comfortable and it felt good lying down after long days. Understandible the elevator and breakfast room were a bit crowded in the morning. Nice and simple hotel, great location, all you need. Would definately visit again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My title pretty much says it all: fairly priced, decent sized, clean and fairly quiet rooms in a super convenient location. Small but satisfactory fitness room. Breakfast was ok in both quantity and quality. Logistics are poor, with the hotel unsatisfactorily served by 2 overused (especially at breakfast time) elevators. Some service glitches to be worked out: faucet in our room was very loose, one day our bed was made but all towels were removed. When we called for towels, they brought us a blanket. When we called again, they brought us to large towels (our room otherwise had three large towels and several small ones). The hotel didn't have a corkscrew when we bought a bottle of wine. In short, this hotel is surrounded on the adjacent blocks by similar properties from similar quality chains; when we booked, the Hyatt was cheapest, and if it was again, I'd stay there, but if not, I'd book whatever among them was cheapest since I suspect that all are similar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel. After a red-eye from Seattle, we had requested for an early check-in 7:30 am (which was unrealistic), the front desk agents got us a room by 10. The rooms were nice, comfortable and cozy. Not too huge. It is New York!!! But very nice, clean and comfortable rooms. The staff at the front desk - Dulce, Zofia and Rosalyn were professional, courteous and amazing. They were good at what they did and just made our stay even more memorable. House keeping was always punctual; free breakfast - not a huge selection like Hyatt Grand etc, but a very nice one. Limited thoughtful choices, which covered various meal preferences such as - fruits, eggs, vegetarian, meats... Easily save at least $15 per person for breakfast everyday. The rooms were CLEAN and COMFORTABLE. The hotel is very well centrally located. There was the Kati Roll Company, Bryant Park, Times Square, Grand Central terminal and even the 34th street subway station entrance just around the corner. We also found the citibike's location right around the corner from the hotel, so getting around was a breeze! The staff was happy to provide recommendations for touristy stuff, local activities, subway directions and what were an absolute must. This hotel is definitely a must stay in NYC. I would happily stay here if / when I go back to NYC again! Thank you Hyatt for making it such a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was in for 2 nights of business and enjoyed my entire stay. All the staff were polite and welcoming and the location very convenient. For the past few years I've been staying more in Upper Midtown West; it was nice to mix it up and stay a bit south again. The room was decent in size and comfortably appointed, from the bed to all the essentials, especially for my short trip. The breakfast that is included and served every morning was ample, featuring staple morning fare that you would expect. I didn't get to check out the gym, but did use their computer and printer; they also faxed a document for me at no extra charge. The elevators are a bit slow as stated in other reviews of the hotel. Regardless though, all the other positive aspects of the hotel far outweigh this one weakness. I would definitely stay there again for both business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place Midtown is very underwhelming. First and foremost, the staff was fine, no complaints. However, the overall experience was just subpar. We had to stay in the city and this was the best point redemption option for NYC; unfortunately for us it was probably Hyatt's worst property in Manhattan. We arrived at 3:30 for check in and was told our room was not ready, so we walked around for another hour waiting for housecleaning to prep the room. When we got there we asked for a phone charger and was told they don't have any. The room itself is ok, it reminds me of a motel than Hyatt Place property. It irked me that the housekeeping cart sat in the hallway during our entire stay, it was saddled with dirty cups and such. Lastly, the morning breakfast was a zoo, just jam packed with people. For me, the value just wasn't there, I wish we had just splurged another 10k points and stayed another night at the Park Hyatt on 57th.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As the prior writer, we too had an awesome check-in experience with Zofia on Memorail Day weekend... Great smiling face with this beatiful attitude... Hotel is new & very fresh and clean... great location for midtown with local fare all around the hotel... great hotel for price point...
user_name:
Robert H
Colts Neck, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff was phenomenal and fun! The concierge, Rich is my new best friend! Wonderful fresh rooms and a delicious breakfast. Convenient parking a few doors down. Great views of the Empire State building too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: THis hotel is central to Manhatten action, subway, restaurants. Stayed for 3 great nights around halloween October 2014. The staff were friendly and helpful,and a buffet breakfast was included in the price. Rooms were spacious and the bed was very comfotable. Would stay there again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Place New York Midtown South last month when visiting New York. Our view of the Empire State Building was just awesome. It was centrally located and we could walk everywhere, which we did. Breakfast was pretty good. Everyone takes advantage of it, so you need to get down there early. The rooms are comfortable and the staff is friendly and helpful. We arrived on a Thursday evening and asked for a good restaurant. We ended up at a chinese place around the corner and it was great. The only issue was the elevator, sometimes you had to wait a LONG time for it to come. But other than that, I'd stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location for a quick trip to NYC. Walked to Central Park and Times Square. Short walk to Penn Station for easy return to Newark airport. Easy access to subway to get to Statue of Liberty and 911 Museum.
user_name:
Kathy R
Homer Glen, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We just spent Memorial Day weekend in NYC. It was our first visit to the big apple! Dulce checked us in and she was with out a doubt one of the most pleasant and helpful hotel employees I've ever encountered. We got early check in after we complained about not being able to have an upper floor as promised at booking ( not her fault) and found that the second floor ended up being better for us. She truly went out her way to be friendly and helpful even during this busy holiday weekend!The hotel was small but clean and well run, and it's proximity to Times Square and almost everything was perfect for us! Christian the bartender entertained us at the end of our hectic days of sight seeing with his pleasant New York local views! I would highly recommend it to anyone. The only downside.... The pull out couch didn't come with a blanket. We had 6 of us in the room, so we had to pull one of the blankets from one of the beds. Not a big deal .... But just a reminder if you're trying to squeeze into a room!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I recently enjoyed a week at The Hyatt Place at 36th St. and 6th Avenue in New York City. The service and room were excellent (albeit rather small, even for a Hyatt Place). I had no significant complaints, and found the location, services and facilities very adequate, and plan to stay there again in two weeks Recommended.
user_name:
Michael G
Rochester NY, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Picked this hotel because of its proximity to the convention I was attending. It's right in the middle of K-Town, which was great for all the food options. It's a very low key place, so if you're looking for full service, try somewhere else. Despite that, I had a very pleasant stay. The rooms are large, and the beds are plush. I would recommend getting up early for the free breakfast in the lobby. It can be a madhouse later in the morning. There may be a long wait for the elevator as there aren't a ton of rooms on each floor but over 20 floors. The staff is amazing -- I can't rave about them enough. Definitely five star service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Place on 36th and 5th for a few nights for business but wanted a nice hotel for fun and exploring the city. The location of this hotel is perfect. It's close to everything you want to do. So great price and amazing location = Big win!The staff was so friendly. Breakfast was included and was good. Not the best but give you what you need with cereals, fruits bread,.... the room were clean and I wish i had pick a room with a nice view :( My one issue like most, which was not a deal breaker for me during my trip, is that there are only two elevators, including for housekeeping. So it can be slow...Will pick that one again for my next trips for sure!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Some issues with street noise due to repairs, that week and elevator use by staff to deliver linens every morning to 25 floors using 1 elevator around 8:10am. Othewise both elevators are fast and efficient. 1.5 blocks to subway, some restaurants nearby, near Penn station, and asian restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: At the risk of making this hotel so popular that it's harder to book, I have to rave about it. Great room, great staff, great food, great location. Will come back again and again. Reachable by public transportation and convenient to most of what I do in NYC, this is the perfect hotel for business or leisure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Needed a place to stay in NYC to celebrate my husband's birthday. The Hyatt Place is a great small hotel in a great mid town location.It is an easy walk to the Times Square, Penn Station, many more. The staff was very warm , welcoming and accommodating. The rooms were very clean, the bed - very comfortable - though the room could use a little more updating/ "warmth". Overall - a great place for a short stay or need a centrally located "home base" in NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend. The customer service was wonderful, and the rooms were clean. It was also in a great location, right near 5th and Times Square. We had a late flight leaving on Monday and we wanted to do more sight seeing after our check out time and the hotel had a a bag check to keep our luggage in so we would not have to take it with us. That was so nice and convenient. We would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We decided to arrive two days earlier in NYC so our hotel which we had reserved did not have availability for earlier arrival so we decided to rent for two days at another hotel so we chose Hyatt. We arrived at around 2am and it was very ugly the first sight. Piles of garbage was standing in front of the hotel. We drove so we had to park our car at a nearby municipal parking, you have to take the vehicle the hotel does not have valet service. The room was very small and the hallways to get to the room were castrophobic. At night you would hear the sirens of the police cars as I guess the to the structure of the building it seemed that you had a window open. In the morning to get the elevator was a mission as it is very slow. We took the stairs always. The complimentary breakfast is not even worth waking up early as there is very little space to sit and eat. Very disorganized. At night I did not feel safe at all, the door of the hotel was open and people would come in like nothing that did not even stay at the hotel. No security what so ever. Not very clean in front of the hotel, it felt you were staying in an industrial area. Very ugly looking. The bathtubs drain was not very good, the room felt like it was not clean. We were disgusted to even sleep on those sheets. No to say the towels would be best to throw away. Not looking forward to staying here again or at a Hyatt if it's going to be like this.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Tonight is my last night out of five that I stayed with my spouse in this centrally located New York midtown hotel, just two blocks from Penn Station and the largest Macy's in the planet. Ended up on the 25th floor room 2502 due to the amazing client salvaging skills of a very human hotel manager with the name of Charmaine Warren that did the right thing when we were ready to take our bags and move to another hotel. After being on the road for a week we stayed one night and due to a less than firm king bed we could not sleep at all. We were ready to move on due to misunderstandings with the Hyatt guest rewards desk when Charmaine just plain asked what would it take to make us satisfied. We then went to just be tourists in New York. We had no idea when we arrived back to the hotel almost at midnight which room we would be assigned. To our total surprise we got a room in the back of the building, which most reviewers here tend to recommend all to avoid. We got much more than anyone would ever expect out of a hotel room. We got a room with the magical view of an unobstructed Empire State building. Yes, the one that King Kong climbed, the one so tall that a bomber crashed into it. See the picture we are attaching to this review. And thanks to a keen manager, Charmaine -who recognized our frustration and made our stay in a magical room. thanks!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is on 36th Street near Penn Station. Because 36th is not a main thoroughfare, even though my room was on the street side, it was pretty quiet (not the endless honking and siren noise I have experienced elsewhere). Staff was pleasant and smiling, breakfast room was large enough that one didn't feel crowded, room was of a good size and the internet access was of high quality and dependable. It was an easy walk to many places and I would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is definitely more than what I would pay for the type of hotel & especially room. The picture looks a lot better than the hotel itself. Room was small & amenities were lacking, hotel needs renovation..
user_name:
Emily K
Hermosa Beach, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Large rooms for NYC standards in this price point. The location is the best in midtown. Lots of restaurants close by. Many attractions and shopping within walking distance. Request a room that doesn't face 36th St. if you want a quieter room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel offers great value based on its location and room type.Breakfast is included, not amazing but a bonus.Great room with comfortable sofa as well as huge bed.Coffee machine was a plus.24 hour food availability is also very useful.Nice outside area.Free wi Fi was very good.Service was excellent especially house keeping lady.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First room: had a family in it Second room: wrong amount of beds Third room: finally correct an hour after check in with a horrible view As a platinum member I expected more. The staff did not really seem interested in resolving our problem quickly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Plusses: extremely convenient location to multiple subway lines, nice comfortable room, excellent breakfast buffet, the coffee provided in room w. coffee maker better than average, lots of electrical outlets, good internet access in room and computers/printers free to use in lobby. Minuses: moderate to long wait at elevators at peak times; breakfast coffee not so good; VERY difficult to hail a taxi from the hotel & we were not offered help in doing so. Pluses outweigh the minuses. Overall we were quite happy with this hotel.
user_name:
Richard F
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was looking for a hotel with breakfast included just to spend one night in NYC. I got a good deal for the room. The hotel is in a convenient location, walking distance from Macy's and Times Square. The staff is helpful, the hotel is clean, bed is comfortable. My only complain is that I found 3 hairs on my breakfast, I don't even like to think about it because I was almost finished eating the eggs, so gross! Also the elevators are REALLY slow in the morning. You better use the stairs.I would stay there again, just won't eat any scrambled eggs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location, walking distance to Macy's. Conveniently located in the heart of Manhattan. Rooms were standard as expected - clean and not very spacious given that its Manhattan. Breakfast wasnt so great but for the price we got, it was great value for money!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: But don't go for the free breakfast, get out and buy breakfast, unless you hate your stomach. location is not bad close to east and west side, if traveling by amtrack using Pen station, reasonably close.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The very friendly and accommodating staff, comfortable rooms, and convenient location combined to make our experience a very pleasant one. We have already recommended HP/NYC to friends and plan to use this hotel when we return in the future.
user_name:
Susan B
Manchester, NH, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 10 days for business and a vacation. Very good, clean, friendly staff, good and ample breakfast. Only two elevators, which mean long waits at peak times or when someone hit all the buttons, but given the building's footrpint, there's no room for more. But the closet was 18 inches wide. Only three drawers, no towel racks. We had to ask for an additional rack. The hotel provided promptly. Aside from the storage question, which is not unusual for NYC hotels, a very good place and overall a very pleasant stay.
user_name:
Donald V
Chapel Hill, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was the best priced room for six in NYC. Booked room directly from Hyatt. Understandably snug, but very comfortable and very clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was a nice bonus. Location was great. We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place on West 36th street was ideally placed for us to get around New York. Ideal mid-town location. Walking distance to Time Square and Broadway, subway 200 metres away. I could see the Empire State Building almost next door out my bedroom window. Included breakfast is not so great since the room is way too small for the number of guests, but if you manage to find a seat or are happy to wait, the offering is not bad. Other great places to eat around here anyway, and food is so cheap in NY. I would definitely stay here again as it was great value in such a great city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: NYC Hyatt Place is very convenient to the train station, Broadway Shows, restaurants. Within walking distance to those. Service is great, staff helpful, delicious hot breakfast. The rooms are very clean, furnished nicely, with a great view. I am over 75 and I was able to walk from the Penn station, to Broadway Shows, and to restaurant row with no problem. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The cheerfully stored my bags until the room was ready so that I could immediately begin a wonderful experience in NYC. They also stored my bags on the last day until I was ready to leave NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After much searching my partner and I (mid twenties) stayed here for a week in Feb. The room was perfect, the complementary breakfast was great but staff could clean the breakfast area more regularly as it was hard to find a clean table and many days we ate at the deli next door. We requested a number of items which were provided. The room was clean, the bed comfy and just what we like. The location was superb you could walk to many places and there were plenty of places to eat on our doorstep and coffee shops. The subway is a 5 mins walk if that. We booked a taxi via the hotel for our return to JFK we were advised it was a set fee including tips and taxes however we were charged more when we arrived at JFK. Do not let the hotel book it for you! I think i may email and complain but it's on my to do list.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We chose this hotel due to its location in Midtown. Also, I had a hotel price check that would monitor drops. When this hotel dropped, I jumped on it. I have no regrets! The room is small but laid our perfectly! The free breakfast is worth it, you save time and money not having to worry about breakfast. Great selection, decent food. Only complaint: PLEASE clean the tables! Many empty DIRY tables! That's my major complaint. The staff is GREAT! They are all so attentive and seem to really care! Night staff, morning staff, housekeeping, ALL of them were really nice, we are going to miss them! We had issues with our room keys! 6 times they did not work! It got old after the third time! We had to go to 17th floor then come back down. Also, if you get a room facing 36th street, be ready for late night noise! I'm no party pooper, but man, that bar across the street is really ruining the neighborhood! We heard yelling and screaming up until 300 AM, maybe even later! Get a room facing something else!
user_name:
James R
New York Ciry, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location is great as you are only a short walk from Times Square. The room was clean and tidy with THE most comfortable mattress and pillows (which is a must after a long day of sightseeing). The staff were helpful and the breakfast was good. Loved the free wifi and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I came to visit friends in the city and thought this hotel was a good location for us. Overall it was a really good stay, staff was friendly, check in was very quick, free breakfast in the morning was good, and room was clean and nice. We were definitely happy with our choice and would recommend this hotel to anyone

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is ideally located. We were able to walk everywhere or the subway was only three blocks away. Room was quiet and comfortable and clean and had lots of room for two. Pull out sofa as well as two queen beds. Wifi worked well. Large selection for breakfast. Elevator could be slow at peak times. Had a great view of the Empire State from our room. Recommend for a Manhattan holiday. Family friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a great hotel and great location just a walking distance to the Empire State Building.The rooms are clean and well furnished.I would recommend it to people on business. My only negative remark was the rollershades. The black out especially was too hard to pull up and it had popped out of the side tracks and was leaking light badly.I was on an upper floor and woke up early as I could not control the light coming in.I attached a picture.Apart from that, great location, staff and service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel for the $. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. Free breakfast was good. Friendly staff, good location. My only complaints are the elevators were slow, and the bathroom floor grout could use a good bleach scrubbing. There are 3 computers in the lobby available to guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed in many 4 star hotels for both business and pleasure, but this is a 3 star hotel but at 4 star price. Good things first: Room size is decent for NYC, breakfast is included, decor is updated and generally comfortable to stay in, and quite clean. The not so good: Asked for a quiet room, but they put us right at the elevator. Doors keeps banging in the hall way Only two elevators, and they are always full, and quite hard to catch one. Breakfast is simple, but the utensils needs to be cleaner, could see residues on the forks and plates, me and my wife both got sick that day after breakfast. Police knocked on our door at 2am after a late night, couldn't sleep after, they were investigating a case. Asked to reserve an umbrella if there is one, nobody called back, we went down to the lobby and they gave us one. At check out, they did not ask how the stay was, so I decided to post this here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I got upgraded to a city view- awesome! Pparking was only 100 yards away (at a discount), only a short walk to Koreatown, Empire State Bldg, Times Square and 5th Avenue. Breakfast staff was right on, even on a busy busy Saturday morning. The bathroom had a modern fresh design, but the closet was small.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was nice and affordable for NYC. We had a room with 2 queen beds and a queen sleeper sofa. We had a great view of the Empire State Building. Looked gorgeous at night! The breakfast was better than your average included breakfast. The pub and bar are open 24/7. They stored our luggage before check in until our room was ready. Then, they stored it again at check out while we did more shopping. No extra charge for the storage. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My friends and I were looking for a hotel to spend the night instead of commuting back to Long Island. We chose the Hyatt Place over a Hilton (which was cheaper), and it was the best decision! Not only was the room immaculate, but the staff was super friendly and accommodating. I would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location, comfortable, reasonable price, free wi fi and breakfast which most other comparable hotels didn't provide. Have to wait at busy times for a lift/elevator, just need a little patience. Staff were all very helpful and pleasant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, great breakfast, great price. Central to Manhattan, we were close to all major sites. The hot breakfast was not your typical scrambled eggs and sausage. Gourmet style eggs and breakfast sandwiches. The price was lower than other hotels in the same area. 2 blocks from subway. I will be staying here again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If this room had faced the back of the hotel, it would have been much better. If you're a light sleeper, I suggest you request a room facing the rear or go elsewhere. The breakfast is not so great but it was convenient and the service was good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Place was good the people were nice nice beds nice lobby the elevators were slow i waited 3min for one get I floor or you will hear street noise it is pretty when you get a room at the Empire State Building it was good bye

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here after looking for other hotels in NY.We checked in on Monday afternoon with no wait or issues .Staff was professional in everyway.We asked for a view of Empire State building from our 22nd floor room any traveler would have been happy,night time was amazing.Clean bathrooms and room.Heat and air conditioning worked .no issues when I come back to the" City that never sleeps " I would stay here again.Price was very reasonable for a New York hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Clean and friendly hotel. Spacious bathrooms. Nice complementary breakfast included hot and cold selections. Room are small but cozy. Comfortable beds and additional sofa is a plus. Staff is very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed the contemporary and spotless (if somewhat small) room and bathroom (great walk-in shower), the generous breakfast buffet, and especially the helpful and courteous staff - they were terrific, from the front desk to housekeeping to the breakfast crew. The location was very convenient for our needs and an easy walk from Penn Station. Downsides were elevators that took a long time to arrive, lots of families with kids crowding the breakfast area, and towels in the otherwise excellent bathroom that would seem more at home at Motel 6 than Hyatt. The exhaust fan in the bathroom was rather anemic. The fitness center was so-so. The Wifi worked flawlessly. We would stay again if this part of the city were our focus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Pro: clean, plentiful buffet breakfast, good location (12mins to Time Square, 6 mins to Bryan Park, metro 3 mins) and looks like a couple of years new.Con: elevator slow (get room on lower floors so can take stairs ) and had to ask for towels ( 4 guests and provided only two towels ).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We would stay here again. + Great location + Very clean and attractive rooms + City view was amazing with floor to ceiling windows + Free breakfast + Friendly staff - Hotel parking through Meyers Parking Garage very sketchy. Cars are left unlocked with the driver's window down and the keys on the front seat. We left our bags in the car thinking it'd be secure only to learn hours later that it was not. - Only two elevators for 26 floors. Sometimes the wait was a couple minutes.
